column1: Tom Watson put me in touch with Chip Beck. I called Chip
column2: we set up an appointment to meet at a Champions Tour event being held in my town, Palm Coast. We met
column3: he tried it, instantly loved it and was truly excited. He wanted one right then, but it was my original prototype so he had to wait for the first production run.

column1: 13. What was Chip's reaction the first time he used OB?

He was amazed by how simple the concept was and how much it helped him. He was excited to see that it provides immediate feedback so that you can correct yourself right away. ""Limited mobility of the head – so important in putting. This product is a must have for all golfers!"" he said. He immediately became my endorsing professional. I am so pleased and feel fortunate to have such a wonderful human being as an endorsing professional.
14. Have any other touring pros used (not necessarily endorsed) OB?

Bruce Fleisher tried it at the Champions Tour event in San Antonio, when we did the Golf Channel spot. He used it on the putting green and immediately loved it. He was so excited, and his energy and Chip's energy carried over to many other players. Bruce used it in his hotel room and the next day he had, I believe 24 putts, low putting round of the day and he had his first top-five finish in several years. Mike Goodes used one, and shortly after I gave him one, he had his first professional victory on the Champions Tour.
15. What's been the reaction of your students to OB?
They love it and want to know why I didn't come up with this idea sooner!
Can it burn your skin or burn grass or carpeting? Yes, it is safe. It is within the guidelines of the government.
17. How many batteries does OB require?
18. OB is designed to help you keep your head still while putting, but can it also be used for the full swing and chipping & pitching?
Gary Halberg liked the O'BEAM for his full swing. I very much like the O'BEAM for pitching and chipping as well, and many of my students are using it for that and finding great success.
19. Have you seen improvement in your students who use OB?

Yes, dramatic improvement in their putting scores, drastically lowering their golf score. It is difficult to explain to students how putting is the most important part of the game of golf. The quickest way to lower your golf score is to eliminate putting strokes. Everyone tries to hit farther with their driver rather than just practicing putting and eliminating excessive putts. This is why the O'BEAM has been so successful: When a player's putting improves, his total golf score drops!
20. While we're talking about putting and keeping your head still, is there a particular putting theory to which you subscribe? Straight back-straight-through? Inside-square-inside?

I believe that we are all built differently and stroke the putter differently. However, I believe that no matter how you make your putting stroke, it is imperative for the club face to be square at impact and your head still.
21. Who, in your opinion, are golf's top-3 putters?

Seve Ballasteros had to be the best ever, in my opinion. He rarely hit a green or fairway in regulation but was able to get up-and-down better than anyone in the history of the game, which equates to a lot of one putts. He holds five major titles.
Second would have to be Ben Crenshaw. He always had perfect speed on the ball and it would just die into the hole as if it had eyes.

Jack Nicklaus would be third, in my opinion. Just watch the 1986 Masters and you will see for yourself. As a matter of fact, Ballesteros, Crenshaw and Nicklaus all won at Augusta National, in my opinion the toughest test of putting of any course.
22. Can you recommend any books/DVDs that would work well in conjunction with O'BEAM?
The O'BEAM is so simple to use and provides such instant feedback that it really doesn't need a supplement.
23. Do you have any recommendations as to how long you should practice your putting? (x% full swing, x% putting, x% chipping, etc.)
24. Why is it so difficult to keep your head still while putting?

I think there is a natural instinct to want to see where the ball is going. I tell my students all the time, if you lose a ball on the putting green you should probably be looking for another sport to play. There is no need to look for the ball, but instinctively we all do at some point. Also, many people can't recognize when and how much they are moving, which is what makes the O'BEAM so unique. It gives instant feedback. I can actually read my students' faces, as if a light bulb has gone on when they see how much the O'BEAM has moved. Instantly they begin to train themselves to minimize their head movement.
25. Jimmy Ballard says it's all right to move your head a bit
column2: Jack Nicklaus thinks the head should be perfectly still. How can they both be right? Your thoughts?

column1: I certainly wouldn't question Jack Nicklaus' opinion
column2: he has proven that having virtually no head movement during his swing helped make him one of the greatest players of all time. Jimmy Ballard is correct as well, because I don't think it is humanly possible to keep your head perfectly still. There is apt to be at least a bit of head movement with your swing. I believe it is a happy medium. Minimizing your head movement for your own personal swing is what is important. We all swing the club and putter differently, we are all built differently and we all have limits. Keeping your head still before, during and just after impact is crucial for a successful swing and putting stroke.

column1: 26. SOUND OFF: Katie, use this space to talk about anything you’d like … as long as it’s golf related!
I hope that many people will enjoy improved putting strokes as a result of practicing with O'BEAM.
Humble Beginnings for O'Keefe: Confident O'Keefe Chases Pro Golf Dream in a $1 Car
By John Brasier, The Sun News
SURFSIDE BEACH - Katie O'Keefe gave up everything to chase her dream of becoming a professional golfer.
In June of 1991, she left her family, her friends, her home and a solid job as a special education teacher. She traded it all for a $1 car and a dream.
The 29-year-old Rye, N.Y., native packed her big handicap and small financial resources into her newly purchased 1974 Vega and moved from her New York home to the Grand Strand.
For O'Keefe, a former college softball player, it wasn’t a tough decision.
Not many people get a chance to what they really want to do,"" explained O'Keefe, who lowered a 20-handicap to a five in 15 months. ""I just wanted to play.""
After months of mailing letters and researching for a job where she could pursue a pro golf career, O'Keefe got her chance entirely by accident.

While on vacation in March 1991 with her father, ""Chubby,"" O'Keefe was ""discovered"" hitting balls on the range at Deer Track Golf Resort by Billy Delk, who was the head professional at the two courses.
I was hitting some balls and Billy happened to be watching,"" remembered O'Keefe. ""When I was finished, he asked what school I played for and I told him I was out of school.""
He asked me how long I’d been playing and I told him about 6 months. He said, 'We need to talk. Do you have any ambitions of playing golf?'""
O'Keefe wrote Delk a letter asking for an assistant's job. Delk didn’t have an opening, but he did offer her help with her game.
When school ended in June, O'Keefe didn't need much convincing to come to Surfside Beach to work with the veteran teacher.
Though Delk had seen her hitting balls just one time at the practice range, the former Clemson player knew she had the potential to be and outstanding golfer.

The athletic ability and competitiveness that made her an All American catcher were apparent even on the practice tee. She also has the desire needed to make it. At Deer Track, she practices 8 to 10 hours a day.
She had some basic swings that were good,"" said Delk. ""She had a natural athletic ability. It is just something you spot in an athlete.""
Though Delk now teaches at Indigo Creek, Deer Track owner Gary Schaal and his staff have helped O'Keefe with support and advice when she isn't with Delk.

I've always believed that the only thing that will stop me is not being able to generate enough funds,"" said O'Keefe while taking a break in the Deer Track snack bar. ""This is like a gold mine. ""Billy, Gary and the assistants have been just great to me. They always help me when I need it.""
The 5-foot-5 125-pound O'Keefe plays from the regular men's tees. She drives the ball 235 and has superior touch around the greens.

She's taken these talents with work and dedication to improve her game to the next level. Though she never played golf seriously before coming to Deer Track, the former University of San Diego catcher firmly believed she could excel in the sport if given the opportunity.
When I was in college, I was on crutches watching golf on TV,"" remembered O'Keefe. ""I said to myself, that doesn't look so hard.""
Finding a place to play has always been O'Keefe's major problem. Growing up in Westchester County suburbs of New York City, O'Keefe lived near several prominent country clubs, but no public courses.
Without a country club membership, playing golf was difficult. But not impossible for O'Keefe. ""I spent my life sneaking on,"" she said with a smile. ""You just gotta do what you gotta do.""

My brothers and I use to just walk in to the pool a Westchester Country Club with towels and wave at the members, and they figured we were members. One time my brothers got in trouble and were suspended from a club and they weren't even members.""
O'Keefe had the same problem after college. Even when she applied to courses outside of New York, she couldn't find a place to play.
That all changed when she moved into a condo near the clubhouse at Deer Track and began taking lessons from Delk. About six months ago, she bought a membership at Deer Track.
O'Keefe has had money problems since she got here. Her family helps out, but she has to scrimp and save just to survive.
Last summer, O'Keefe worked nights as a waitress, I use to only eat when I was at work,"" said O'Keefe. ""I got real sick when I was doing that.""
O'Keefe said she isn't getting impatient with her rugged lifestyle. She's convinced she'll eventually be rewarded for her hard work.
When will she be ready to take on the LPGA Tour? ""That's such a hard question,"" admitted O'Keefe. ""Who knows? I just really don’t worry about that - I just worry about getting better.""
This year, O'Keefe has shown promise. Besides winning four tournaments in South Carolina, she's been competitive in two national events.
Delk predicts she'll be ready for the Futures Tour, the ladies' version of the Hogan Tour, next Spring.

She's getting very, very close to getting to that level of play,"" said Delk. ""The biggest thing that's going to hold her back is monetary. She can go as far as she wants if she can achieve the monetary backing to go through that next level and make the next step to the professional level.""
If she gets there, O'Keefe won’t be driving a $1 car.

column2: >Hello! I'm Berenice Parra. I majored in Hispanic Literature, I'm a voracious reader &amp
column3: I live in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico. My lifelong passion? Knowledge. My ultimate dream? To create and edit a magazine which deals with an unlimited variety of topics. The world is so broad and diverse - why can't magazines be the same way?

column1: pamphlet is a monthly e-magazine (downloadable for Kindle and iPad
column2: available through subscription only), with a companion blog (available for free to anyone in the world), created by a magnificent group of young new collaborators from different areas, backgrounds and nationalities.

column1: Our reader is a child at heart, who still has the capacity to be surprised. He/She is eager to learn, see, read and experience the world in a single page. Someone who gets high on reality
column2: someone who, as Leo Burnet said, ""is curious about life in all of its aspects"".

column1: We will curate all kinds of content: from international affairs to fashion
column2: from art - music, literature, film, illustration, photography, etc - to television, politics and the state of the Internet
column3: throwing in a necessary dose of fiction and non-fiction writing, pop culture topics, travel, food, design, d.i.y. and more. We believe that life is not a series of classified compartments, but a glorious mixture of everything and anything. We strive to reflect this diversity as much as possible, tearing down the walls, erasing all the labels.

column1: We will curate rich, original content, through an honest, simple approach. Our aesthetic will be as beautiful as it is unique, un the same league with the most renowned periodical publications in the world. We rely on excellent writing and relevant topics, in order to provide our readers the most satisfying magazine experience of their lives. Our passionate team of editors and writers will create content that strives to nurture the heart, mind, body, and soul of our readers. Through excellent writing we will wrinkle brains on current topics. With a simple, unique design and layout we will please the eye. We will inspire creativity. We will discover and share honest, meaningful, and humorous content.
• Because our readers'  thirst for truth and beauty drives us, and we want to provide both in a single magazine for them to read.
• Because we are forever learning and growing and we want to share our knowledge and experience with our readers.
• Because we know how complex the world can be, but we also see how full of wonder it is. We love what we do with a passion and we want to pass that on to others, in every which way possible.

Your contribution will help us set up a website (which will be the blog), cover design fees, technological requirements - such as: higher speed Internet, creation of the magazine in the correct format for iPad and Kindle, etc. -
column4: and, most importantly, provide funds so that we're able to remunerate our staff and collaborators. For us, this will not be a hobby - it will be our legacy, and we want to establish something that will outlast us.

• Lifelong subscription to pamphlet and a special collectors' edition of pamphlet's 1st anniversary issue, in actual pamphlet form - on print, foldable, with exclusive artwork!

After riding in the 2009 inaugural Tour de Timor, The Chain Reaction Project (TCRP) returned to Timor-Leste in 2010 to participate in the Dili ‘City of Peace’ Marathon, running 42 kilometers up mountains, through native villages and along pristine coastlines of the country once ravaged by civil war.
A group of 22 “Catalysts for Change” joined them on their adventure and to continue their support of HIAM Health, a Dili-based malnutrition rehabilitation centre for children.
Together they delivered a SGD$28,000 Playpoint playground and more than SGD$9,500 for the children of HIAM Health.

This August 2013, a whole new bunch of catalysts will be returning to Timor-Leste. TCRP 2013: Timor-Leste Catalysts will endeavor to summit Mt. Ramelau and volunteer at a community garden as part of HIAM-Health's Home Kitchen Garden Project.

This initiative provides nutritious food to malnourished children and an income source for their families. We aim to raise SGD$10,000 in support of their efforts to reduce infant and maternal mortality rates.
Would you partner with us in this mission?
• $10.00 per day will feed a child at the centre.
• $15.00 supplies a hygiene take home pack.
• $25.00 supplies a gardening take home pack.
• $50.00 per month covers the wages for a gardening assistant.
• $70.00 per month covers the wages for a kitchen hand.
• $250.00 per month covers the wages for a qualified nurse.
• $275.00 per month covers the wages for a qualified horticulturalist.

HIAM-Health helps women and children suffering from malnutrition. It takes a holistic approach, rehabilitating children suffering from malnutrition in addition to educating families and communities about proper nutrition.
One of HIAM Health’s initiatives to tackle this problem is through their Home Kitchen Garden Project. This project seeks to provide families with balanced meals and an additional source of income.

HIAM Health’s vision is to empower Timorese people to work together to reduce high infant and maternal mortality rates and to assist in the reduction of poverty and hunger through education and support.
TCRP’s mission is to find a Cause, and have an Effect. We want to inspire and empower people to pay forward the positive social changes they wish to see in the world, and become Catalysts for Change.

The Chain Reaction Project (TCRP) is a non-profit organization that was born in 2009, when four women committed to help change lives in some of the world’s least-developed nations.

United by a passion for adventure and philanthropy, TCRP seeks physical challenges and local organizations that can benefit from their efforts.

For more information on alternative forms of donations, including online transfers, please send an email to: 

info@tcrp.com

On March 26, 2013, Dawna McCoy underwent spinal surgery (Laminectomy, Foraminotomy, and Discectomy) to correct severe nerve root compression, disc herniation, spinal stenosis, and chronic back pain, caused by nearly 15 years of dedicated service as an EMT and medical professional.  She was expected to return home within 48 hours of surgery, but that was just the beginning of her nightmare. Within 12 hours of surgery, Dawna suffered from acute renal failure, hepatic ischemia (shock liver), infection, cholecystitis (inflammation of the gallbladder), and severe blood loss resulting in two blood transfusions. After 3 ½ weeks of pain, fear, and uncertainty Dawna was prematurely released from the hospital. Five days later, she was readmitted after a trip to the emergency room for pain and weakness. It was then found that in addition to her other concerns she also suffered from pancreatitis.

Thankfully, Dawna was released yesterday to continue her recuperation at home, with the help of a wonderful team of outpatient physicians. However, her battle isn’t over… she will be going under the knife again to have her gallbladder removed in a few weeks. She has exhibited such bravery during this time and continues to fight everyday to reclaim her life.

Unfortunately, without being able work and over $20,000 in looming medical bills, additional surgery, doctor’s visits, and prescriptions, Dawna really needs your help to ease some of the financial burden. We know times are hard for everyone, we ask if you can just open your heart enough to help Dawna any way you can. Thanks and God Bless you all!

Access to Dental Care is a constant challenge for many children and adults. The following is directly from the American Dental Association:
""It is a disgrace that so many Americans still lack access to basic oral health care. Kids and adults miss sleep, school and work due to untreated dental disease. They can't eat properly

For years, the American Dental Association has been striving to raise awareness and develop solutions so more people can receive dental care. Dentists lead many of these efforts, but they can't do it alone. We all have a stake in this issue. Government, business leaders, insurance companies, health care professionals and individuals all must work together to get better dental care to the million of Americans who don't receive it.

Oral health care must be a priority. Untreated dental disease can lead to serious health problems: infection, damage to bone or nerve, and tooth loss. Infection from tooth disease can spread to other parts of the body and may even lead to death. Clearly, oral health is just as important as the health of the rest of your body.

Prevention is the key. Dental disease is almost entirely preventable. Drinking water with fluoride in it is very important. Also, simple measures like brushing and flossing teeth every day and eating a healthy diet can protect against tooth decay.

Pain from untreated dental decay results in lost school and work hours. Many with tooth pain seek care in hospital emergency rooms, most of which aren't well equipped to handle dental emergencies, and where the cost of treatment is far greater than a dental office visit. That's why we as a society must help provide access to dental care to underserved people. All of us -- government, business leaders, insurance companies, health care professionals and individuals -- must develop access to dental care solutions that work in our communities.""

At Cornerstone Dentistry, our team of Doctors have been dedicating as much time and resources as possible to serve our communities in pro-bono work. We constantly receive letters from people of all ages as how their teeth are affecting their overall health, work and social status. They cannot easily afford the care they deserve. Not having proper teeth to chew affects the amount of nutrient that their body can receive, thus affecting their entire health. The following is an example of hundreds of letters that we receive in the mail or via email on our face book page. The names of the following people have been covered to protect their privacy.

column2: >The following text has been copied and pasted without any correction to spelling or grammar.

column3: > am 21 years old and have had severe dental problems for years. bad teeth run in my family but i seem to have gotten the worst of it. my teeth are very weak and break off at the gums so there is still tooth in there and the holes can not close fully, or gums grow over broken bits of teeth which is painful. i cannot eat without pain, and my teeth will randomly start bleeding fom the holes in my gums. i live with constant pain, and am embarrassed to smile or even go in public sometimes. i have no insurance and am living with my in laws as my husband was released from the military. i really need some help and i know you do some pro bono work, but i dont even need it for free, i could find some way to do a payment plan if someone else needed the pro bono more than i do. all i ask is to be considered. it would mean more than the world to me if i could live my life again. thankyou so very much for taking the time to read this.

column1: How are we going to use the raised funds?

Cornerstone Dentistry currently operates 3 locations in southern California with further scheduled expansion. The practices typically are servicing regular fee for service patients on average about 3 days a week with an additional 2 days a week available to serve people in need in our local communities. That is a total of 24 days a month combined among all of the offices. Our group consists of 6 dentists, 2 dental hygienists and 15 support staff members. With our current infrastructure in place, we are capable of utilizing the major part of all money raised in operating and providing dental care for patients in need.
How we will qualify patients that need treatment?

The program is open to any adult or children with a limited income or those who are referred to us with various organizational groups that have similar mission than us. Thus we do require proof of income from those who are seeking to benefit from this program. The program will provide up to $2000 per adult and $3000 per child in the areas of infection control, caries control, emergency dental services and restorative dentistry. If required treatment is beyond the covered benefit, an option of option of low cost treatment and payment options will be provided to each individual.
This is your opportunity to help a fellow human being in need of basic dental care and help Cornerstone Dentistry expand its pro-bono work in their local communities.
What other ways I can support your cause?

If you are not able to support us through your own funds, we appreciate it if you can promote our cause within your group of friends and family in various social networks that you belong to. Everything counts, as you will be helping your fellow human beings in need.
The following are the photos of typical dental situations that many patients suffer from.

From Cornerstone Dentistry inbox Facebook page

I am 21 years old and have had severe dental problems for years. bad teeth run in my family but i seem to have gotten the worst of it. my teeth are very weak and break off at the gums so there is still tooth in there and the holes can not close fully, or gums grow over broken bits of teeth which is painful. i cannot eat without pain, and my teeth will randomly start bleeding fom the holes in my gums. i live with constant pain, and am embarrassed to smile or even go in public sometimes. i have no insurance and am living with my in laws as my husband was released from the military. i really need some help and i know you do some pro bono work, but i dont even need it for free, i could find some way to do a payment plan if someone else needed the pro bono more than i do. all i ask is to be considered. it would mean more than the world to me if i could live my life again. thankyou so very much for taking the time to read this.
How are we going to use the raised funds?

Cornerstone Dentistry currently operates 3 locations in southern California with further scheduled expansion. The practices typically are servicing regular fee for service patients on average about 3 days a week with an additional 2 days a week available to serve people in need in our local communities. That is a total of 24 days a month combined among all of the offices. Our group consists of 6 dentists, 2 dental hygienists and 15 support staff members. With our current infrastructure in place, we are capable of utilizing the major part of all money raised in operating and providing dental care for patients in need.
How we will qualify patients that need treatment?

The program is open to any adult or children with a limited income or those who are referred to us with various organizational groups that have similar mission than us. Thus we do require proof of income from those who are seeking to benefit from this program. The program will provide up to $2000 per adult and $3000 per child in the areas of infection control, caries control, emergency dental services and restorative dentistry. If required treatment is beyond the covered benefit, an option of option of low cost treatment and payment options will be provided to each individual.
This is your opportunity to help a fellow human being in need of basic dental care and help Cornerstone Dentistry expand its pro-bono work in their local communities.
What other ways I can support your cause?

If you are not able to support us through your own funds, we appreciate it if you can promote our cause within your group of friends and family in various social networks that you belong to. Everything counts, as you will be helping your fellow human beings in need.
The following are the photos of typical dental situations that many patients suffer from.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign

This November 108 lives Australia plan to bring Solar Power to Mount Summit Boarding School in Kathmandu, Nepal. We want to give hot water for showers and bathing to the young students at Mount Summit before the freezing temperatures of Nepal's Himalayan winter set in.

The school helps as many families affected by poverty as they can. Children that would otherwise not get an education are housed, fed and cared for by the school. They are also supplied with their books and other school requirements.

Mount Summit School is an intensely social and community minded organisation in
Kathmandu, striving to do all they can in support of children in need. They believe deeply in the opportunity and life changing benefits that education provides, and they continually strive towards this aim.

Even with the benefits the children gain at Mount Summit, conditions are rugged by our standard. The age of the children range from 4 to 16, and the unfortunate, but often necessary separation from parents and family is emotionally distressing to many of the very young students.

The students live at close quarters together, dorm style. Warmth and comfort are a necessity for the health and wellbeing of the young children, they often have colds and runny noses, and the older students have their own hygiene needs as they develop.

Imagine in the middle of winter, with a chill in the air, a bare brick cubicle with bare cement floor, bare light globe hanging from the ceiling....which is ok when the electricity is on! No comforts...it is bare, drafty and cold! Now imagine sending your kids to have a shower.

You can help.....by helping the school with its wish to install Solar Panels for hot
water, the children would finally have the comfort of hot water for showers....something we all take for granted in the western world. But for  these children, it would be a gracious gift!

With the addition of power storage, the solar panels will also provide enough back up power for running lights when the main power supply is down. This is a daily occurrence in Nepal with load shedding being a national practice for coping with
power demands.
$1,800 will cover costs for the Solar Panel set up and installation (with a little margin for fees and charges).

As with all 108 lives projects funds raised go directly to the cause for which we are campaigning. Unlike large Not-For-Profits with large overheads, our projects are carried out by volunteers. We like to see funds go to their designated cause just as much as you do!
If we do not reach our goal this time round, the funds will be added to at our next fundraising opportunity until this project is accomplished!
108 lives Australia have previously succeed in supplying benches to Mount Summit School, helping to address the problem of crowding in the classrooms.

With our most recent project earlier this year, Bev Carter and Jo Grant returned, installing 8 computers providing learning access to the school and students (...you might have caught that campaign here). A very satisfying and meaningful result that will directly affect the educational outcomes for hundreds of children!
You can experience this wonderful feeling from giving too!
While we have successfully accomplished each set task, we continue to work beyond the scope of each project, establishing new networks, connections and partners.

My name is Bev Carter and I volunteer with a small organisation called 108 lives Australia and The 108 lives Project internationally. With a mission of compassion, and giving with the intention to improve and change lives, this project will be my third volunteering trip to Nepal and my second for this year!  With your help I believe we can build on the great successes we have had helping people in Nepal.
The time and effort I have put into these projects has truly been amongst the most rewarding experiences I have had!
If you can’t contribute, please help to share!

We are equally grateful if you are able to help support our campaign by spreading the word. You can help us to reach as many people as possible, and we will have a
greater chance of reaching our target.
Indiegogo share tools are a great way to share!  Share on Facebook. Tell your friends.
Further Perks are being sourced.  Please keep an eye out for updates through the course of this campaign.

Rise Against Ebola

 Hello, our names are Barrett, Charlie and Alex

      We are in the seventh grade and have recently caught wind of the Ebola Virus, and the pain and havoc it is causing. We are trying to obtain some money so we can donate to directrelief.org, and help the victims of Ebola, and their families. Please be philanthropic about this and contribute to those in need.

About Ebola

     Ebola is an extremely dangerous virus that has an average fatality rate of at least 70%. With no licensed vaccines or treatments, catching Ebola is almost the same as receiving a death sentence. The first cases occurred in the year 1976 in Sudan and The Democratic Republic of Congo. The name comes from the Ebola river which flows through Yambuku, the town and area where many of the first cases appeared. 

There are 5 different species of Ebola, and the 2014 outbreak is caused by a member of the Zaire species. The virus itself can be transmitted through contact of blood, secretions, and bodily fluids of infected animals or humans. Contaminated surfaces such as bed or clothes that have made contact with fluids, blood, or organs are major vectors that have a key role in spreading the virus. As long as blood and bodily fluids are infected, the human or animal is still capable of spreading Ebola. As of 9/30/14 the first diagnosed case of Ebola has been reported in the US. Since then there have been 3 more.

Our Mission

     Our goal is to obtain $1000 to donate to directrelief.org. This company sends medical items over to the Ebola stricken countries such as, saline bags, exam gloves, isolation gowns, boxes of sterile syringes and needles, rubber boots, cases of face masks, and protective shoe covers. We will send the donation to the Ebola response in West Africa. The money and items would help these people immensely, it would save lives, and help stop the Ebola Virus. Please help and donate to this cause, though even if you can't donate, please refer us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Google, thank you. 

Works Cited:

http://www.directrelief.org http://www.w...

http://www.dogonews.com/2014/9/29/making-sense-of-the-ebola-virus

We are raising money to pay for the medical and dental work needed to reset Lyson's upper jaw, three root canals to stop infection, to replace three front teeth and restore her bite and smile.

Riding home from a friend's family home on Christmas night, Lyson was knocked from her bike. The impact was sudden and a heavy blow to the head gave her concussion. When she gained consciousness her bag along with her wallet, mobile and all other lifelines were gone.

Because the accident happened over the Christmas holidays, Lyson could not receive immediate dental care. She has made every effort to be seen by public health medics, but waiting lists are long and the earliest appointment is already too late. Because she has an infection, there is a risk that it will spread. Her teeth themselves are dead and need to be replaced, and fractured bones that risk infection need urgent care.

Lyson is left with no choice but to get treatment from a private dentist at a cost of £5,000.

Lyson's many loyal and devoted friends want to see her well again. We can of course only support her so much, which is why are relying on the kindness of strangers to help make her better. 

Please help us raise money for our dear friend. Any contribution would be so much appreciated. We want to see her smile again!

Sincerely,

Christopher and Kate

When you look on him, you might be surprised and fooled when someone try to tell you that this kid is sick - he is like a ""quicksilver"" - he is everywhere, asking million questions per minute. Recently he started individual education at his home, in order to prevent any infections, and became a huge fan of Star Wars - his favourite character is Lord Vader.

More pictures and informations (unfortunately in Polish) you can find on Simon's Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/sercedlaszymona?fref=ts

Also more details in Polish again on the webpage - http://szymek.frostfire.vxm.pl
If you would be interested to know more about him feel free to contact me directly and I will try to answer to all your questions.

Well, we need to collect almost 37.000 EUR for the second surgery - first one which happened last year in Munster, Germany - under control of dr. E.Malec was successful and Simon is a joyful young kid who is howling to live forever!
We already performing similar crowd funding action in Poland, his parents and the Foundation is organising concerts to collect the money, charity actions are also held.
The next surgery need to be made ASAP as the body of this young person is growing fast and the heart might not stand.
1. first - made in 2014 - already happened - doctors were surprised that after 2 days from the surgery he was running on the corridor like he was cured for flue
2. second - which should happened this year - fingers crossed to collect the money
3. most probably next year (2016) if all will be fine after the second surgery.
Unfortunately apart of big THANK YOU we can not give you more

Pastor Ray Reeder

Pastor Ray needs his brothers and sisters to rally around him and his family as they face many bills due to his current hospital stay:

• He pours his life out on the streets of Las Vegas to minister God's grace, truth, and healing to all he meets.
  • Co-Founder of Riding With Jesus MC. RWJMC ministers every Sunday night at Hope Chapel and through out the week on the streets.
  • Pastor at Casa De Luz in Las Vegas.
We have all been impacted by his minister and love for Jesus
column2:
let's help our brother out and show him some love.

He needs our prayers and support:

Make a difference in his life, family and ministry with your prayers and financial gifts.

column1:
• Staying at the hospital for multiple days costs a LOT of money!
  • Partner with Pastor Ray today and help him pay for his bills and sow into his ministry.
  • All funds go directly to Pastor Ray.

Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) hardware

Laser medicine has always been considered expensive and complex. Well, not anymore. Our dedicated team of medical professionals and UX designers have come up with a solution which gonna treat wounds, sprain and rash like, for example, herpes with low-intensity laser beam (120 mW, 808 nM) super efficiently at home or on the go. Several researches prove that treating certain illness with laser beam reduces healing time 2 to 6 times. Our tests show that it's possible to prevent early-stage herpes and get momentarily relief. Treating herpes with LLLT prolongs remission time significantly.

The product is fully tested on all age groups, skin-types and allergies. It is 100% safe for domestic use. Now is the time to apply for all necessary certificates which would allow us to call it a medical device. This is where we need your help - to raise funds for certification process and get the first batch of the product to our first happy customers.

Cells and tissues that are placed under our skin thrive for the sunlight. Like our bodies are programmed to wake up with a morning light, cells become active when they receive a low-intensity laser beam. They think of it as the sun rising above the horizon. LLLT treatment improves immunity, microcirculation in blood and lymphatic vessels.

column3: >First LLLT device with its mobile app

column1: You can control and monitor your BambooLaser with a mobile app on your smartphone, connected to a device via bluetooth. It gives you more targeted, more individualized and precise treatment for each case. The app runs on iOS and Android smartphones, it keeps your treatment history, reminds you of necessary sessions and shows the status of the battery. BambooLaser device is charged via micro USB port and the battery lasts up to 2 weeks when used regularly and more than 2 months when used passively. It has ergonomic design (inspired by bamboo) and it's environmentally friendly.

We've been blessed by a dedicated team of professionals - each at his or her own area. We believe that the team can bring BambooLaser to life and make the dream of affordable laser treatment at home possible!

Well, we don't have any certificates yet for BambooLaser and we really hope that with your help this could be solved in months time. Similar devices on the market with significantly lower efficiency rates have received CE and SEMCO standard certificates in EU as well as all necessary paperwork to operate in the U.S./Canada markets give us strong conviction that this challenge will be overcome.
Also we're looking for an important addition to our team at this very moment - an experienced product manager. To be true, none of our team has ever been involved in a hardware production before.
We gonna work on BambooLaser's design in the following months and that is why it may look a little bit different than the prototype. But be sure, improvements will only please you.

","Low-level laser therapy (LLLT) hardware Laser medicine has always been considered expensive and complex. Well, not anymore. Our dedicated team of medical professionals and UX designers have come up with a solution which gonna treat wounds, sprain and rash like, for example, herpes with low-intensity laser beam (120 mW, 808 nM) super efficiently at home or on the go. Several researches prove that treating certain illness with laser beam reduces healing time 2 to 6 times. Our tests show that it's possible to prevent early-stage herpes and get momentarily relief. Treating herpes with LLLT prolongs remission time significantly.

The product is fully tested on all age groups, skin-types and allergies. It is 100% safe for domestic use. Now is the time to apply for all necessary certificates which would allow us to call it a medical device. This is where we need your help - to raise funds for certification process and get the first batch of the product to our first happy customers.
The best ways to use BambooLaser:

Cells and tissues that are placed under our skin thrive for the sunlight. Like our bodies are programmed to wake up with a morning light, cells become active when they receive a low-intensity laser beam. They think of it as the sun rising above the horizon. LLLT treatment improves immunity, microcirculation in blood and lymphatic vessels.
First LLLT device with its mobile app

You can control and monitor your BambooLaser with a mobile app on your smartphone, connected to a device via bluetooth. It gives you more targeted, more individualized and precise treatment for each case. The app runs on iOS and Android smartphones, it keeps your treatment history, reminds you of necessary sessions and shows the status of the battery. BambooLaser device is charged via micro USB port and the battery lasts up to 2 weeks when used regularly and more than 2 months when used passively. It has ergonomic design (inspired by bamboo) and it's environmentally friendly.

We've been blessed by a dedicated team of professionals - each at his or her own area. We believe that the team can bring BambooLaser to life and make the dream of affordable laser treatment at home possible!

Well, we don't have any certificates yet for BambooLaser and we really hope that with your help this could be solved in months time. Similar devices on the market with significantly lower efficiency rates have received CE and SEMCO standard certificates in EU as well as all necessary paperwork to operate in the U.S./Canada markets give us strong conviction that this challenge will be overcome.
Also we're looking for an important addition to our team at this very moment - an experienced product manager. To be true, none of our team has ever been involved in a hardware production before.
We gonna work on BambooLaser's design in the following months and that is why it may look a little bit different than the prototype. But be sure, improvements will only please you.",8.0,0,"1 Campaign

The Outdoor Anchor Accessory was suggested by backers and made for monkiis.  

This is now available as an add-on for all backers. Just add $25 to your pledge and you’ll get the Outdoor Anchor Accessory shipped with your pocket monkii. Here's how:  

Step 1: If you've already backed click on the “Manage your Pledge” button while you’re viewing the pocket monkii campaign page. If you haven't backed just add an additional $25 to whatever pledge level you are choosing.

Step 2: Click on “Change your Pledge”.  

Step 3: Scroll to your Current Reward and ADD $25 to the current amount shown. Then hit “Continue”. 

Step 4: Hit “Confirm” to save your changes and secure your Outdoor Accessory Attachment.
column67:
>

We forgot to mention that pocket monkii will be MADE IN THE USA (Colorado and Wisconsin). This has been something we’ve fought to continue from our beginnings 5 years ago. We’ve had such a successful first 2 weeks that we are ready to make that commitment. Let’s call it the $500,000 stretch goal for fun.
column68:
>

Bodyweight Training with Pocket monkii is a highly effective way to train because it allows you to move through a maximum range-of-motion during your entire workout.
column70:
>

After starting this 21-Day introductory program, you may feel and/or see muscles you never knew you had, you may push some boundaries, and most of all you’ll have some fun.
column71:
>

Upon completion, you will have formed a habit of daily movement which will ensure a more active, healthier and happier life.
column73:
>

The 35-Day Challenge is designed to fast-track your monkii training and make you as strong, fit, and wild as possible in only 35 days.
column74:
>

At the end of this program you’ll be able to do more, look amazing, and feel great.
column82:
>

In 2016 we launched monkii bars 2 on Kickstarter - with nearly 6,000 backers and over $1 million raised - it currently holds the record as the most funded fitness product in Kickstarter history. 

After successfully delivering to all backers, we listened.  With their feedback in mind, we literally started from scratch and re-designed pocket monkii from the ground up. Watch the video below to see monkii Dan walk you through some of his favorite design updates.
column92:
>

""I’m super excited about pocket monkii, as it will be the perfect compliment to my MB2. I love my MB2 as a permanent set up in my basement, but it is a hair cumbersome to tear down and set up. I think the pocket monkii will be the perfect solution for travel - just flip over the door and go. I also love that the handles look a bit smaller in diameter and that they just slide up for the foot straps to be used - super efficient. Thanks again, and I can’t wait to try out the new pocket monkii since I love my MB2 so much!"" - monkii Corrina

""I'm all in! Sounds like you are making some fabulous improvements!"" - monkii Charles

""I'm super excited about this kit! It seems to fix the only thing I wasn't a huge fan of with my monkii bars 2, the setup time."" - monkii Mike

""Loved the Monkii Bars 2, but will definitely be looking at the pocket monkii. This way, I'll have a set to keep to myself (my son tends to hog MB2). On top of that, the quicker setup looks great, and the core add-on is something I could benefit from."" - monkii Angus

""WOW, this is exactly what I wanted! I’ve traveled with a Minaal brand backpack for some years and I needed a lighter and easier-to-setup monkii!"" - monkii Sergio

Dealing with Paralysis and SCI/D

I knew my life would change, but I didn't know that managing my bladder would be the most challenging task I faced on a daily basis.  As a individual living each day with paralysis resulting from spinal cord injury, I understand just how terrible the current standard of care can be for managing Neurogenic Bladder.  Every day, I have to insert small dispoable catheters into my body in order to relieve my bladder of urine.  These devices have changed very little over the past century and I believe it is time to innovate radically to improve the quality of life for people like me.

This is expensive and unhealthy.  Urinary Tract Infections are the leading cause of rehospitalization for people with SCI/D and the current process of catheterization is archaic and medieval.  The plastic tube used to drain the bladder is essentially the same as any plastic straw.

Neurogenic Bladder is a condition that affects millions of Americans every year.  It often leaves a person unable to sense the fullness of their bladder and unable to control the voiding process.  This means that users often go to the bathroom more than they need to, avoid drinking anything but water, totally dehydrate themselves before a car or plane ride, and resort to virtually anything that will prevent them from having an accident in public.  This condition doesn't just affect people who were traumatically injured, the truth is that if you live long enough you have a pretty high chance of developing some form of urinary incontinence.  Other conditions that may result in Neurogenic Bladder include:
The main methods of management for Neurogenic Bladder all have significant drawbacks and issues.  The methods of management include:

Intermittent (Disposable) Catheters (L): Disposable catheters that are inserted 5-10x per day.  The risks associated with this method include infection, false passage (urethral trauma), and strictures.

Indwelling (Foley) Catheters (R): A semi-permanent catheter that connects to a urine collection bag on the leg or wheelchair of the user.  Risks associated include infections and trauma to the bladder wall from the tip of the catheter.

Suprapubic Catheters: The same as an Indwelling catheter but requires a surgical incision in the stomach for the catheter to access the bladder.  Also connects to a leg bag but comes out of the stomach.

The Solution = A ""Smart"" Catheter

Although the Connected Catheter™ utilizes some highly innovative and advanced technologies, our team has taken a problem first approach to solving this issue and are trying to accomplish two primary objectives:

column4: >Tell me when my bladder is full
>Let me empty it without inserting catheters into my body 5-10x per day

column1: In doing this we also have identified secondary aims that we know will create and capture value for providers and insurers.  We are committed to improving this experience for users, clinicians/providers and payers all at the same time.  We hope to improve patient outcomes while decreasing costs for any payers (supplies and costs of care).
The technology behind the Connected Catheter™ allows us to achieve the following key product features (many of which have never been incorporated into a product for users):
Semi-Permanent - One Connected Catheter will last for approximately one month and may replace as many as 200 intermittent (disposable) catheters.
Minimally-Invasive - The Connected Catheter is inserted and extracted through the urethra almost exactly the same way that intermittent and indwelling (Foley) catheters.
Fully-Internal - The Connected Catheter is fully internal to the body.  The valve is positioned at the base of the penis and is easily actuated by the user.
Quickly Inserted/Removed - Our insertion/extraction mechanism allows a clinician or user insert/remove the device so that it can be removed in the event of Autonomic Dysreflexia or any other issue.

Connected - Our device wirelessly relays pressure data to an external device that alerts a user when their bladder is full and about to void.  This also offers clinicians the opportunity to utilize predictive analytics and advanced software algorithms to make more informed decisions.

The Impact

Many people don't realize just how debilitating the conditions associated with paralysis can be.  It is common for people to see a wheelchair and think ""Oh man, that must be really tough because he/she can't walk.""  I thought the same thing before my injury but what I learned was that the human body was not designed to spend the entire day in a seated position.  A variety of secondary conditions result from this issue that are often more troubling than the mobility issue.
In peer-reviewed research, a doctor asked paraplegics and quadriplegics what function they would choose to return if they had the option and
column4: >, Sexual Function, and Bowel/Bladder Function all as more important than the ability to walk.  This is similar for quadriplegics except that they also would rather regain Hand/Arm function ahead of walking in addition to the Trunk Stability, Sexual Function, and Bowel/Bladder function.  This is the truth that most people don't see and prefer not to talk about (because it can be embarrassing
>The Impact our product can have is vast.  One Urologist with over two decades of experience treating Neurogenic Bladder said,

column1: ""Imagine the improvement in quality of life for the millions  of patients who wear permanent indwelling urinary catheters or do intermittent catheterizations...  As someone who has managed thousands of patients with neurogenic bladder and urine retention who need the assistance of a catheter to maintain renal function, this device  could be revolutionary in its impact.""

>In the past few months we have been successful in local business plan competitions and were accepted to a highly-competitive virtual accelerator this past summer.

column2: >In addition to these recent accolades, our team has been involved in many other aspects of medical technology, some of which have been publicized widely.  One example of this is when our CEO and founder, Derek, became the first person in the USA to own a personal ExoSkeleton (a device that allows paraplegics to stand and walk).  With this device Derek was able to stand and walk to be awarded the Bronze Star medal (with V) at his retirement ceremony this past November.

>Our team has made many other contributions to advancing science and supporting world-leading medical research.  If you are interested in learning more about our experience please feel free to email us and we would be happy to talk more about this in a separate forum.

column1: This is a HUGE undertaking.  Traditionally, medical devices that are regulated by the US FDA (like ours will be) and other regulatory agencies abroad don't fare well on crowdfunding websites because it is such a complex and challenging landscape to navigate.  The reason we have chosen to launch this campaign is because we HAVE to generate support.  The momentum from this campaign will raise money (which is essential for our success) but will also show any potential investors that this is a significant issue.  If you are unable to donate any money, please support us by leaving a note of encouragement, sharing our story with friends, or by giving any sort of feedback (positive or negative).  The only way we can be successful is with your help.

Additionally, we have analyzed the risks associated with this project thoroughly and have noted the following key components which we will address continually throughout the development and fielding of our product:

Engineering: We have identified and are hiring a world-class team of engineers to assist in developing this product.  We also have identified external consultants that will be critical in supporting our engineering processes.

Regulatory: We have worked diligently to identify and address any potential risks throughout our design process.  We will continue to ensure the product meets the highest levels of safety and testing standards as set forth by applicable US FDA and other regulatory agencies (in applicable geographies).

Market Adoption: We have talked with thousands of stakeholders.  For the past few years of my life I have made myself an expert on paralysis and met so many people who have confirmed the same problems and complaints that I experience.  Our team has spent time with world-leading clinicians to ensure that we can design a product to meet the complex needs of our target population.

column3: >The entire Spinal Singularity team would like to personally thank you for visiting this page.  We have been continually humbled by the support and generosity we have received.  If you are unable to donate any funds please help us in one of the following ways:
>Tell us about your Neurogenic Bladder Experience!
>Leave a comment or email us any feedback!!

column5: >The valve is designed so that when

column1: the bladder reaches a certain pressure (just below the safe limit), the valve
will open with or without user input. This feature is critically important and
will dramatically change the way that neurogenic bladder is treated because
currently, with ICP, a person’s bladder can reach a level where the pressure is
high enough to cause the bladder to spasm. If the bladder sphincter does not
open when the bladder spasms, then urine will be shot back up to the kidneys
where it is likely to cause a kidney infection (bladder detrusor-sphincter
dyssynergia). With The Connected Catheter, we can eliminate the possibility of
the bladder ever reaching a dangerous level, and improve patient safety because
the valve will open whether or not a user is actively managing this function.

The main methods of management for Neurogenic Bladder all have significant drawbacks and issues.  The methods of management include:

Intermittent (Disposable) Catheters (L): Disposable catheters that are inserted 5-10x per day.  The risks associated with this method include infection, false passage (urethral trauma), and strictures.

Indwelling (Foley) Catheters (R): A semi-permanent catheter that connects to a urine collection bag on the leg or wheelchair of the user.  Risks associated include infections and trauma to the bladder wall from the tip of the catheter.

Suprapubic Catheters: The same as an Indwelling catheter but requires a surgical incision in the stomach for the catheter to access the bladder.  Also connects to a leg bag but comes out of the stomach.

The Solution = A ""Smart"" Catheter Although the Connected Catheter™ utilizes some highly innovative and advanced technologies, our team has taken a problem first approach to solving this issue and are trying to accomplish two primary objectives:
Tell me when my bladder is full
Let me empty it without inserting catheters into my body 5-10x per day

In doing this we also have identified secondary aims that we know will create and capture value for providers and insurers.  We are committed to improving this experience for users, clinicians/providers and payers all at the same time.  We hope to improve patient outcomes while decreasing costs for any payers (supplies and costs of care).
The technology behind the Connected Catheter™ allows us to achieve the following key product features (many of which have never been incorporated into a product for users):
Semi-Permanent - One Connected Catheter will last for approximately one month and may replace as many as 200 intermittent (disposable) catheters.
Minimally-Invasive - The Connected Catheter is inserted and extracted through the urethra almost exactly the same way that intermittent and indwelling (Foley) catheters.
Fully-Internal - The Connected Catheter is fully internal to the body.  The valve is positioned at the base of the penis and is easily actuated by the user.
Quickly Inserted/Removed - Our insertion/extraction mechanism allows a clinician or user insert/remove the device so that it can be removed in the event of Autonomic Dysreflexia or any other issue.

Connected - Our device wirelessly relays pressure data to an external device that alerts a user when their bladder is full and about to void.  This also offers clinicians the opportunity to utilize predictive analytics and advanced software algorithms to make more informed decisions.

The Impact Many people don't realize just how debilitating the conditions associated with paralysis can be.  It is common for people to see a wheelchair and think ""Oh man, that must be really tough because he/she can't walk.""  I thought the same thing before my injury but what I learned was that the human body was not designed to spend the entire day in a seated position.  A variety of secondary conditions result from this issue that are often more troubling than the mobility issue.

In peer-reviewed research, a doctor asked paraplegics and quadriplegics what function they would choose to return if they had the option and paraplegics reported Trunk Stability, Sexual Function, and Bowel/Bladder Function all as more important than the ability to walk.  This is similar for quadriplegics except that they also would rather regain Hand/Arm function ahead of walking in addition to the Trunk Stability, Sexual Function, and Bowel/Bladder function.  This is the truth that most people don't see and prefer not to talk about (because it can be embarrassing).
The Impact our product can have is vast.  One Urologist with over two decades of experience treating Neurogenic Bladder said,

Imagine the improvement in quality of life for the millions  of patients who wear permanent indwelling urinary catheters or do intermittent catheterizations...  As someone who has managed thousands of patients with neurogenic bladder and urine retention who need the assistance of a catheter to maintain renal function, this device  could be revolutionary in its impact.""

We have assembled a talented team of engineers and clinicians to develop this product.  Currently, there are two full-time employees (1 MBA, 1 PHD), two part-time consultants (2 PHD), and a large network of advisors (financial, clinical, regulatory, reimbursement, product development, federal grant writing).
In the past few months we have been successful in local business plan competitions and were accepted to a highly-competitive virtual accelerator this past summer.

First Place at UCLA Anderson School of Management, Knapp Business Plan Competition - http://blogs.anderson.ucla.edu/anderson/2015/05/judges-tap-spinal-singularity-first-prize-knapp-venture-competition.html

First place at UCLA Institute for Technology Advancement (ITA) Student Engineering Venture Competition - http://www.venturecapital.ucla.edu/blog/spinal-singularity-wins-last-week-s-ucla-ita-venture-competition

Derek presenting at the Wilson, Sonsini, Goodrich, Rosati Medical Device Conference as a semi-finalist in the MedTech Innovator Accelerator program -http://medtechinnovator.com/company/spinalsingularity

In addition to these recent accolades, our team has been involved in many other aspects of medical technology, some of which have been publicized widely.  One example of this is when our CEO and founder, Derek, became the first person in the USA to own a personal ExoSkeleton (a device that allows paraplegics to stand and walk).  With this device Derek was able to stand and walk to be awarded the Bronze Star medal (with V) at his retirement ceremony this past November.

Our team has made many other contributions to advancing science and supporting world-leading medical research.  If you are interested in learning more about our experience please feel free to email us and we would be happy to talk more about this in a separate forum.

This is a HUGE undertaking.  Traditionally, medical devices that are regulated by the US FDA (like ours will be) and other regulatory agencies abroad don't fare well on crowdfunding websites because it is such a complex and challenging landscape to navigate.  The reason we have chosen to launch this campaign is because we HAVE to generate support.  The momentum from this campaign will raise money (which is essential for our success) but will also show any potential investors that this is a significant issue.  If you are unable to donate any money, please support us by leaving a note of encouragement, sharing our story with friends, or by giving any sort of feedback (positive or negative).  The only way we can be successful is with your help.

Additionally, we have analyzed the risks associated with this project thoroughly and have noted the following key components which we will address continually throughout the development and fielding of our product:

Engineering: We have identified and are hiring a world-class team of engineers to assist in developing this product.  We also have identified external consultants that will be critical in supporting our engineering processes.

Regulatory: We have worked diligently to identify and address any potential risks throughout our design process.  We will continue to ensure the product meets the highest levels of safety and testing standards as set forth by applicable US FDA and other regulatory agencies (in applicable geographies).

Market Adoption: We have talked with thousands of stakeholders.  For the past few years of my life I have made myself an expert on paralysis and met so many people who have confirmed the same problems and complaints that I experience.  Our team has spent time with world-leading clinicians to ensure that we can design a product to meet the complex needs of our target population.

The entire Spinal Singularity team would like to personally thank you for visiting this page.  We have been continually humbled by the support and generosity we have received.  If you are unable to donate any funds please help us in one of the following ways:
Tell us about your Neurogenic Bladder Experience!
Leave a comment or email us any feedback!!
technological solution for patients with neurogenic bladder. Our solution is a
semi-permanent, minimally-invasive, “smart catheter” system that measures bladder pressure and
wirelessly transmits data to a smartphone, allows the user to control a
valve to empty the urine from the bladder, eliminates the need for
intermittent catheters and drainage bags, can be inserted/removed by the
user (or clinician) in minutes, and is fully encapsulated in the body
to reduce the risk of infection.
The user data will be cataloged
through a cloud-based software program and will provide meaningful insight for
clinicians and researchers. Clinicians will be able to utilize this data for
predictive analytics, identifying and treating potential issues in their
earliest stages, and researchers will have new metrics to analyze any potential
correlations between bladder pressure and other clinical indications.
Currently, no one has captured this uro-dynamics data in a meaningful way.
both a valve and a miniaturized (passive RF) pressure sensor. The device will
be inserted into the bladder of an individual with minimally invasive means by
the individual or by a clinician to accurately detect the pressure exerted by
the urine in the bladder. This device will be made out of safe, FDA-approved
materials that will be tested for accuracy, reliability and safety prior to
being inserted in the bladder designed to withstand the environment in the
bladder, and not irritate the bladder wall lining.
monitor bladder pressures and once the pressure threshold (~40cm H2O) is
reached in the bladder, an alert will be sent to the user’s smartphone (or
other external device) notifying the user that their bladder is approaching the
safe limit. The user will then go to a bathroom where they can safely empty
their bladder by squeezing the duckbill check valve at the base of the penis.
The user will be able to control emptying of the bladder by applying a gentle
amount of pressure to the valve (similar to a CamelBak Bite Valve).
The valve is designed so that when
the bladder reaches a certain pressure (just below the safe limit), the valve
will open with or without user input. This feature is critically important and
will dramatically change the way that neurogenic bladder is treated because
currently, with ICP, a person’s bladder can reach a level where the pressure is
high enough to cause the bladder to spasm. If the bladder sphincter does not
open when the bladder spasms, then urine will be shot back up to the kidneys
where it is likely to cause a kidney infection (bladder detrusor-sphincter
dyssynergia). With The Connected Catheter, we can eliminate the possibility of
the bladder ever reaching a dangerous level, and improve patient safety because
the valve will open whether or not a user is actively managing this function.
to stay in a patient’s body up to 28 days before it must be replaced.
How is it inserted and removed?
inserted into the bladder of an individual with minimally invasive means by the
individual or by a clinician. The device will be able to be easily removed by
an individual or by a clinician within a matter of minutes.
What does the pressure sensor do?
utilizes passive RF technology to accurately detect the pressure exerted by the
urine in the bladder. Dynamic software algorithm will monitor bladder pressures
and once the pressure threshold (~40cm H2O) is reached in the bladder, an alert
will be sent to the user’s smartphone (or other external device) notifying the user
that their bladder is approaching the safe limit.
All RF exposure resulting from use
of The Connected Catheter will fall within the safe limits, outlined by the
FCC. To learn more, please refer to this guide by the FCC:
There is a robust portfolio of patents and all technology disclosed in this campaign is patent pending.  Please contact us to learn more about our intellectual property status.

suffer from neurogenic bladder in the USA. This condition is a dysfunction of
the urinary bladder due to disease of the central nervous system or peripheral nerves
involved in the control of micturition (urination). Individuals with neurogenic
bladder may not feel the urge to void or feel a sense of bladder distension.
condition use catheters to relieve their bladders of urine, and they often
cannot determine when or how often they need to void because they lack
sensation. This puts individual users at risk for increased complications (such
as urinary tract infection and false passage) and results in a waste of medical
supplies, such as disposable intermittent catheters.
commonly associated with neurological disorders such as paralysis from spinal
cord injury and disease (SCI/D). It may also be caused by any of the following
Birth defects of the spinal cord
Damage or disorders of the nerves
that supply the bladder can also cause this
