1. Initial Goal, $30k: Reaching this goal will allow us to source ingredients from manufacturers that only produce their products in allergen free facilities. It will also provide us with the capital to secure a dedicated convection oven that is not shared with other vendors to help protect against the risk of cross contamination.
2. Stretch Goal 1, $45k: Reaching our first stretch goal will allow us to obtain a dedicated commercial mixer, a dedicated cooktop, prep tables, etc... for producing our delicious cookies.

3. Stretch Goal 2, $75k: Reaching this goal will allow us to open the kitchen space we found outside of Washington, DC. This kitchen will be dedicated to producing only Bakeovers and other foods that are free of peanuts, tree nuts (EXCEPT FOR COCONUT that is not produced with any other tree nuts), gluten, and other top food allergens. This is critically important.

4. Stretch Goal 3, $100k: Reaching our third stretch goal will allow us to get kitchen help, which is vital to reaching production volumes in order to cover the costs of a dedicated facility. Such staffing will also help us have ongoing, monthly checks of our suppliers to ensure that their own sourcing, production, or fulfillment has not changed to maintain the integrity of our brand, giving you a product you can trust.

column3: >Who doesn't love a good cookie? And who wouldn't love a good cookie that is good for you?

column1: If you are trying to eat healthier, or are limited by what you can eat because of illness or food allergies, there is little on store shelves to choose from that isn't made with either tons of sugar, loads of genetically modified ingredients, artificial colors, preservatives, and more. That's especially true of treats. I want to change that.
My love affair with cookies started at an early age. Some of my happiest memories are of making cookies from scratch with my mom.

I wanted to share those same memories with my four kids, but I was eager to make something they would love, with ingredients that would love them back. I wanted to make them a treat that I could feel good about giving them, not guilty. And one that was safe for my kids - all of whom have food allergies.

I couldn't find a treat that tasted great, packed a nutritional punch, while being free of the top food allergens - gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg, and soy. So I set out to make over - or bake over - my favorite baked goods, starting with cookies. With that, my first Bakeover was born...One Smart Cookie!

Bakeovers are made from only natural ingredients, nothing genetically modified or processed. And they're free of gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg and soy. Bakeovers’ One Smart Cookie tastes so good that you’ll never know they’re good for you! You'll reach for another. And another. Without the remorse.

We took our cookies to anyone who would taste them - with or without food allergies. Friends, strangers, retailers, chefs - anyone with taste buds and an affinity for a good chocolate chip cookie. To read what others have to say about our cookies, please visit our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/bakeovers.

column2: Tested our Recipes until we had one that was fantastic

column1: • Obtained UPC Product Codes necessary for selling the cookies in grocery stores and other retailers
• Set up an eCommerce Web Site for when we launch

• Sourced Ingredients from reputable suppliers who provide only natural ingredients that have not been genetically modified and are not produced with any of the top food allergens (gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg, and soy)

We need your help for the home stretch - building an allergen free commercial kitchen in which to make Bakeovers. There are no allergen free commercial spaces - we need to build one and our goal will enable us to acquire the equipment and open a space. Every dollar above our goal will go towards third party certification to further ensure the safety of our facility.

Please consider backing our campaign to raise the bar on the foods we eat. We are incredibly appreciative of any support you can give. And if you'd consider sharing our story with friends and family via email, Facebook, or other social media, you would really help us to make it possible to open an allergen free commercial kitchen in which to make Bakeovers.
Bakeovers is committed to supporting those in need, and will donate a portion of every bag sold to local food banks and soup kitchens.

1. Initial Goal, $30k: Reaching this goal will allow us to source ingredients from manufacturers that only produce their products in allergen free facilities. It will also provide us with the capital to secure a dedicated convection oven that is not shared with other vendors to help protect against the risk of cross contamination.
2. Stretch Goal 1, $45k: Reaching our first stretch goal will allow us to obtain a dedicated commercial mixer, a dedicated cooktop, prep tables, etc... for producing our delicious cookies.

3. Stretch Goal 2, $75k: Reaching this goal will allow us to open the kitchen space we found outside of Washington, DC. This kitchen will be dedicated to producing only Bakeovers and other foods that are free of peanuts, tree nuts (EXCEPT FOR COCONUT that is not produced with any other tree nuts), gluten, and other top food allergens. This is critically important.

4. Stretch Goal 3, $100k: Reaching our third stretch goal will allow us to get kitchen help, which is vital to reaching production volumes in order to cover the costs of a dedicated facility. Such staffing will also help us have ongoing, monthly checks of our suppliers to ensure that their own sourcing, production, or fulfillment has not changed to maintain the integrity of our brand, giving you a product you can trust.
Who doesn't love a good cookie? And who wouldn't love a good cookie that is good for you?

If you are trying to eat healthier, or are limited by what you can eat because of illness or food allergies, there is little on store shelves to choose from that isn't made with either tons of sugar, loads of genetically modified ingredients, artificial colors, preservatives, and more. That's especially true of treats. I want to change that.
My love affair with cookies started at an early age. Some of my happiest memories are of making cookies from scratch with my mom.

I wanted to share those same memories with my four kids, but I was eager to make something they would love, with ingredients that would love them back. I wanted to make them a treat that I could feel good about giving them, not guilty. And one that was safe for my kids - all of whom have food allergies.
And my kids are not alone....

I couldn't find a treat that tasted great, packed a nutritional punch, while being free of the top food allergens - gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg, and soy. So I set out to make over - or bake over - my favorite baked goods, starting with cookies. With that, my first Bakeover was born...One Smart Cookie!

Bakeovers are made from only natural ingredients, nothing genetically modified or processed. And they're free of gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg and soy. Bakeovers’ One Smart Cookie tastes so good that you’ll never know they’re good for you! You'll reach for another. And another. Without the remorse.

We took our cookies to anyone who would taste them - with or without food allergies. Friends, strangers, retailers, chefs - anyone with taste buds and an affinity for a good chocolate chip cookie. To read what others have to say about our cookies, please visit our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/bakeovers.
To date, we've accomplished the following:
Finalized & Tested our Recipes until we had one that was fantastic
Completed Food Analysis & Secured FDA Approved Food Labels
Obtained UPC Product Codes necessary for selling the cookies in grocery stores and other retailers
Set up an eCommerce Web Site for when we launch

Sourced Ingredients from reputable suppliers who provide only natural ingredients that have not been genetically modified and are not produced with any of the top food allergens (gluten, peanuts, dairy, egg, and soy)

We need your help for the home stretch - building an allergen free commercial kitchen in which to make Bakeovers. There are no allergen free commercial spaces - we need to build one and our goal will enable us to acquire the equipment and open a space. Every dollar above our goal will go towards third party certification to further ensure the safety of our facility.

Please consider backing our campaign to raise the bar on the foods we eat. We are incredibly appreciative of any support you can give. And if you'd consider sharing our story with friends and family via email, Facebook, or other social media, you would really help us to make it possible to open an allergen free commercial kitchen in which to make Bakeovers.
Bakeovers is committed to supporting those in need, and will donate a portion of every bag sold to local food banks and soup kitchens.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
<h3>I love creating yoga classes with accessible, thought-provoking
themes layered into my own style of alignment-based Yoga. Over the years
I've studied, tested myself, and taught over 2,000 hours of yoga.

Now, I (finally) know what I want to say and how to say it.

 As a yoga teacher I am uniquely qualified not only to help people struggling with
gender identity and sexuality, but I'm also gifted in supporting
self-acceptance, body image, and self-love in my students ---
something WE CAN ALL IDENTIFY WITH. It's my job as a yoga teacher to
make sure that students who would

love my classes can find me, and enjoy all I can offer them.

So please help me spread my message and art through online yoga classes! It'll make studying yoga with me accessible for communities outside
the Bay Area, and give local students a chance to try out my classes
before signing up for workshops, trainings, and my YoGay (queer and
trans yoga) retreats. Creating yoga classes over the years has been
therapy for me and sharing them has provided meaningful work for me and

authentic connections with so many of you.

...here's our chance to make something together:

$4,000 will cover video production costs including: camera work,
editing, and web management. The result will be a comprehensive and

accessible yoga series to stream or download on Vimeo.
 I already have an amazing support team to

help me deliver these videos in 2016!

*Please Contribute lovingly!
*Take a moment to share on social media. Sharing is caring

sparkleyogamassage@gmail.com
www.yogay.net
www.sparkleasyouare.com

The smartest and most affordable way to see your angles of address in real-time. Now you can perfect your posture on and off the course before you take the shot.
'The Talon is a total game changer' - National Club Golfer
""Ojee Golf has unveiled its revolutionary Talon training aid"" - Golf Monthly
Gearhacker: The 5 Best Geeky Golf Gadgets to Instantly Improve Your Game
CLICK HERE TO READ ALL OUR LATEST REVIEWS

You can never expect to achieve a consistent swing if you set up to the ball differently each time. TALON gives you the opportunity to achieve your optimum posture position before you strike the ball. You'll know if your shoulders have dropped or if your back is overarching, even if your club-face is open, closed or square to target! TALON removes the guesswork and helps you to practice purposefully bringing you one step closer to achieving consistency in your game.

column7: >So, how important is your set-up / posture?

column5: >Well two of the games greatest had something to say on the matter

column1:
""I feel that hitting specific shots -- playing the ball to a certain place in a certain way -- is 50 percent mental picture, 40 percent setup, and 10 percent swing."" 
Jack Nicklaus

""What invariably distinguishes a good player from a poor one is their respective address positions or setups.""
David Leadbetter

""If you set up correctly, there's a good chance you'll hit a reasonable shot, even if you make a mediocre swing. If you set up to the ball poorly, you'll hit a lousy shot even if you make the greatest swing in the world.""
Jack Nicklaus
From day one these informed words were the driving force in our pursuit to develop a training aid unlike any other out there - and the TALON was born.
Our wireless back unit measures your spine angle.
The digital display unit attaches to the grip of your club and measures the
Our clever technology syncs and works out the club shaft to spine angle.
With the digital display unit pre-aligned, we measure and display the rotation
Comfortable and adjustable Talon belt designed to support the back unit

How you set up and address the ball is fundamental to every golfer’s game, from beginners to professionals. However, teaching, learning and replicating the optimum set up for golfing success has previously relied upon basic unreliable methods which cannot be quantified or accurately replicated. For example, relying on 'feel', looking in a mirror and retrospective video analysis.

We have developed a revolutionary new training aid that gives you real-time visual feedback on your golf stance and angles of address. TALON removes the guess work and gives you all the critical information you need to set up to the ball with the same posture, every time – improving muscle memory, consistency and optimum performance.
up and attach the TALON gripper to any club you would like to use. The TALON digital display unit simply clicks
in and out of the gripper, allowing you to easily switch the unit between
different clubs you may be practising with. When you are not using the TALON a
smart rubber cap fits over the gripper protecting it in all weathers, meaning
you can leave the gripper in place at all times.
The digital display and back unit are
charged via a USB connection and provide 8 hours of continuous use, plenty of
time for a leisurely 18 holes or some hard core practice on the range.
What great Indiegogo EXCLUSIVES are up for grabs?

We've been fortunate enough to have partnered up with some fantastic individuals and companies within the game to offer some amazing limited edition product exclusively to the Indiegogo community. Take a look below at some of the great perks we have on offer.
We've had an excellent response from golfers of all levels throughout our user trials and some really influential figures within the industry, who were happy to express their thoughts on the TALON:

“What Ojee TALON will help you do is understand the position you need to be in to perform optimally so you can play your best game more often”
Tony Westwood, Westwood Golf Academy, PGA AA Professional and Level III Coach

“I was pushing a lot of shots and didn't know why, so the thing that has really helped me is being able to see the angle and degree of the club face”
Graeme Allen, 10 handicap, regular club player.

“Being able to correct the most fundamental portion of your game is a total game changer”
National Club Golfer Magazine

“By providing the kind of coaching that is usually provided only by PGA certified pros, Ojee will enable golfers to get their game in shape wherever they happen to be”
National Club Golfer Magazine

column2: >Ojee Golf was founded in 2014 by Matt

column1: always looking for a problem to solve""
""Like most golfers I need all the

column5: >Between us we decided to solve a

column1: critical problem for golfers which has not previously been addressed by
training aids or affordable technology – how to achieve a consistent &amp

column8: >And we've come a long way in the last 12 months

column1: We start working on the idea and this
chunky fella is our first 'Proof of Concept' prototype. No prizes for looks but
it proves our concept and successfully provides real-time digital information
We ditch the black box approach and
now the TALON is really beginning to look the business. Attaching to the
grip-butt of any club in your bag, this early version of the TALON clearly
displayed the 4 critical angles within the golf setup. We exhibit at the London
Golf Show to gain customer feedback and are thrilled with both the reception
and input for the product.

column5: >It's been an incredible journey and here we are at the final hurdle - with your help we can bring this innovative and exciting new product to the golfing market. Manufacture is a costly process and our last step towards putting the TALON into your hands.

column1: TALON is the first of many new products we want to develop here at Ojee Golf. Posture and set-up is a vitally important part of the game and until now has been relatively overlooked in the tech world.

With your help we can deliver the TALON to market and begin to demonstrate just how important it is to be able to consistently set-up to the ball in your best position. Not to mention you'll be one of the very first to get your claws on the TALON and start proving our philosophy for yourself!

We're confident that we have a great product and know that golfers of all levels will find value in using the TALON. Without the support and drive of our growing community our pursuit to get the product out there will run deep into 2016 and delay progress on the other innovative and exciting products we want to get into your hands. We truly believe there are a number of ways we can help you to improve your game by promoting purposeful practice with great new golf tech - it's what drives us to keep going!

Spread the Ojee love and share the campaign with your golfing buddies, follow us on twitter and like us on Facebook. Sign up at www.ojeegolf.com and we'll keep you updated on what's next for Ojee and the TALON.

And if you want to get in touch - just drop me a message at matt@ojeegolf.com and we'll be happy to help! 

Thank you all!

Matt &

Cancer treatment is a difficult process that takes a toll on the body and the mind. Patients spend numerous hours in hospital rooms that are cold and impersonal.

""Share the Warmth"" is more than just about the distribution of scarves. In its pure essence it's about making a human connection with others to let them know they are not alone on their journey. Local nonprofit organizations have agreed to help us distribute the scarves. Now all we need to do is start knitting, but first...

We Need Your Help!

Your donation will cover the cost of producing each scarf (yarn, ribbon, tissue paper and gift bags). Make a pledge by choosing a perk that fits you.

How much should I donate?

$5 every little bit helps 

$10 helps us donate one scarf

$20 helps us donate 3 scarves

$50 helps us donate 8  scarves


Your Donation Will Be Transformed. Take A Look!
• Help us spread the word about our campaign by sharing the ""Share The Warmth"" story with friends and family.
Like us on Facebook and get updates about what we've been up to. Here is our link: https://www.facebook.com/craftdwithlove

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us.

Thank you so much to everyone who contributed to our campaign and helped spread the word!

We are still in the development process at the moment. However, the process has been slowed due to funding issues. We are currently amounting the remaining balance ourselves, but it will take longer than we had expected. Therefore, the fulfillment date will be pushed back until we have sufficient funds - we're working hard at it!

Thank you!

Created for those who want to get more out of life - Root10 was built to be the simplest method to a leaner, healthier you. Whether you're looking to lose 10 pounds, find ideas for healthy meals, or a great workout plan - Root10, our 30 day online program, is here for you.
Now we need your contributions in order for us to be able to release this product - every Contribution towards our funding goal helps!

column2: >For many people, living that leaner, healthier life is challenging - and we think that sucks. So we spent the past two years designing a program that helps you
column6: >live the life you want to live.  You now get to breeze through 30 days of awesome content towards losing a solid 10 pounds. We've even put everything online for your mobile and tablet so you can access it whenever and wherever you need it most.

column1: For those who demand more from themselves - who want more out of life. For your husband or daughter, friend or loved one who's been held back by endless cycles of gimmicks and tricks. It's for you to break free and get that leaner, healthier life you've dreamed of. It's here - and it's now. It's time to get rooted.
Root10 was carefully crafted to help you reach your goals. Whether it be the last 10 pounds, or the 50 pounds to change your life - we're going to do it together - 10 pounds at a time.

We have - hands down - the simplest meal plan. This was made possible by designing our nutritional plan around a concept we call Guided Freedom. Simply put, we carefully tailored each of our recipes to have an identical amount of calories. That means you get to choose from any of our delicious meals every single day. No fuss - No calorie counting.
Confusing recipe instructions are no fun, so we've created a short video for each of our recipes.
By using nothing but real everyday food found at your local grocery store, you get to understand the building blocks of your success.
We like things easy - so we created a shopping list feature that makes grocery shopping the simplest experience yet.
Every recipe is precisely tailored to your daily caloric needs using influential variables.

We're bringing the experience of a personal trainer to the palm of your hand. Over the past two years, we've taken Miguel's 4 years of personal training experience and human kinetics studies to create the Root10 program. From crisp trainings, healthy habits to live by, and the motivation you need to reach your gaols - it couldn't be simpler. Because to us - your journey is as important as your destination.
New content every day to keep you moving and motivated!
If you're a busy person - no worries! We've got you covered with workouts that fit more in less time.
We've broken the program into 3 progressive phases to keep your body guessing and results coming.
Our cardio acceleration workouts help your body burn extra calories on your down time. Essentially - you burn calories while doing nothing!
And now, we are ready to bring Root10 to you - Your Journey has yet to begin!

We all know how important living a leaner, healthier life is. But sometimes, with so many quick fixes and shortcuts, we can lose sight of what's really important. We hope to give everyone the chance to experience the life they want to live - by empowering them with all the tools they need right at their fingertips. The next step after Root10 is even more exciting, but first we need your help to bring Root10 to the market.

We've invested lots of time and effort over the last 2 years - and put in north of $15,000. The content is close to done, with only a small amount of editing left to be finalized. Now - we need your support to take the next step. We will be working closely with our web development team in Toronto to ensure you get the best possible experience with Root10.

We set our funding goal to $10,000 - and we already invested $15,000 of personal funds. That leaves us with $12,883,28 unfunded - and that's ok. With a successful campaign, we will cover the unfunded portion with a term loan. We strongly believe Root10 will change the lives of countless people, so we're prepared to do whatever it takes.

As with any campaign, there are certain risks associated to the journey. There can be certain delays on fulfillment due to development issues, capital issues, and more. However, we are committed to delivering you Root10 - and we will do what it takes to get it into your hands as fast as we can!

As a new and emerging car enthusiast group we would like to start raising a fund for Breast Cancer Awareness Community as  a whole. 

There is no one way to cure cancer. It has been researched that there are many ways to cure or treat cancer. Together we can all overcome and beat cancer. We can break ONE pencil, but imagine trying to break THOUSANDS of pencils at once. The more we have, the stronger we are to beating cancer.


All 100% of Proceeds will go to The Rose Cancer Foundation.

Gwen had worked for decades as a nurse in Canada's north. And she was good at it. Her aboriginal and Inuit patients trusted her. Her colleagues valued her expertise. And then things came to an abrupt stop. Gwen had blown the whistle on an incompetent nurse
column2:
one whose practice was later associated with the death of a 3 month old baby boy. What did the Government of Nunavut Department of Health, her employer do? They fired Gwen and ordered her never to return to Nunavut. They cut off her livelihood for doing the right thing. And they promoted the incompetent nurse. How devastated personally and professionally could one nurse be for following all the rules. Gwen fought fearlessly to protect the residents of Cape Dorset, Nunavut. Her 3 year fight for what was right has finally come to resolution. The incompetent nurse has agreed to all the allegations presented to her. Her license has been suspended. Gwen's selflessness and moral, professional and ethical duty has also come at a great price. She is a heroine in the nursing community and a true angel to the many Nunavummiut in Cape Dorset and elsewhere who are safer now because of her. Gwen deserves our tributes and help in rebuilding her financial ruins as a result of the horrendous treatment she received from her former employer. Her aged mare just passed away and she barely hangs on to a few horses that she has left now on her small farm property. Below you will find the links to this very sad story and the nurse who was willing to speak up and do the right thing:

href=""http://www.cbc.ca/news/multimedia/nunavut-put-c...""

www.cbc.ca/news/canada/north/nunavut-nurse-admi...""

Below you will find the links to this very sad story and the nurse who was willing to speak up and do the right thing:href=""http://www.cbc.ca/news/multimedia/nunavut-put-c..."" www.cbc.ca/news/canada/north/nunavut-nurse-admi...""",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: The inPocket Pro socks are the world's most comfortable, versatile and supportive football socks. Developed with an inside shin guard pocket and produced from high performance fibers with graduated compression, these socks provide a pleasant softness sensation and revive your tired legs, while allowing you to maintain your legs protected from injuries.
Inside pocket to hold a shin guard

With the inPocket Pro socks, you do not need tape or strap to keep shin guards up, nor do you need to pull them up repeatedly during the game. These seamless double-layer knitted socks work with an inside pocket to hold your shin guard securely in place by the action of graduated compression of the outer layer. This enhances your comfort, while maintaining leg protection and preventing strangulation of your calves. The pocket is not restrictive to a certain size, as the inventive pocket is suitable for any length of your shin guards.

column2: >Graduated compression for improved performance and recovery

column1: Compression varies from 17 to 22 mmHg (conform to BS6612:1985), exerting the highest pressure at the ankle, and decreasing in intensity towards the calf. This compression assists the veins in pushing de-oxygenated blood back to the heart and, therefore, it improves blood and oxygen circulation in your feet, ankles and legs and reduces muscle vibration, soreness and fatigue for enhanced performance and quick recovery.

column2: >Special composition for extra comfort and breathability

column1: Polyamide microfibers are lightweight, hypoallergenic, super-absorbent and provides a pleasant softness sensation to your skin. The yarn structure is porous enough to let the skin breathe, while offering high strength properties. Fibers are engineered to keep you cool and dry by moving moisture away from your feet, and comfortable by offering outstanding quality, and performance.

column2: >3D knit structure for higher breathability and reduced risk of slips

column1: The foot part of the socks was engineered as a 3D knit structure for ultralight ventilation that enhances breathability and promotes quick elimination of moisture.
3D cushioned lines were knitted in the bottom of the foot to increase friction thus prevent your foot from slipping inside your boots.
Cushioned regions were selectively placed in high-impact areas of the foot sole to provide maximum comfort and help prevent blisters.
You hardly need a pen and pad for this, as the product is created coherently for your convenience.
1.            You put your inPocket Pro sock on one foot and pull it up (if you are the superstitious type, then obviously your preferred foot first)
2.           Simply place your shin guard in the pocket.
3.           Repeat process for the second foot.
Time to play the beautiful game in the knowledge that you’ll never have to waste time and money again to buy extra sleeves or tape. Now, focus on the match.
The inPocket Pro Socks are for football athletes of all levels, gender or type: professional, amateur, student or novice, male or female, association football or indoor soccer.
They are recommended for any football player, who wants to up her/his performance and comfort, get that extra edge needed to outperform herself/himself and reach higher achievements in game.

More than just a football garment, the inPocket Pro socks can be worn in many different activities as walking, running, or even while resting and recovering. Graduated compression improves blood and oxygen circulation, alleviates swelling and inflammation, reduces muscle soreness and fatigue, speeds up your muscle recovery and relieves tired legs. Therefore, inPocket Pro socks are also a great garment for you to practice light fitness, recreational and relaxation activities with fashion.

We have been working diligently on this remarkable product for about a year now. We have developed dozens of prototypes that were meticulously investigated in terms of comfort, design, effectiveness, freedom of movement, suitability and quality by our team of designers, engineers, and doctors specialised in biomechanics.

Throughout both the testing and validation processes, volunteer professional football athletes had accustomed themselves to the product and were able to give their candid verdict. Alterations and adaptations were driven by our findings, and subsequently they matched the athletes’ recommendations on what they consider integral for enhanced performance and comfort.

column2: >Portugal is known by quality and innovation on textile. “Made in Portugal” is on the rise.

column1: Our socks are designed and manufactured locally in Portugal. We account for a highly collaborative and innovative Portuguese textile company. A company that has an extensive experience and expertise in developing graduated compression garments for elite athletes, that is also one of the most experienced and innovative textile companies in Europe.

Our manufacturer complies with the European Directive and is subject to constant monitorization for quality control in accordance to the internationally recognized Quality Management System ISO 9001. It is certified with the Portuguese Standard for Research, Development and Innovation (NP 4457) and was distinguished as a SME Leader. All products comply with medical devices Directive 93/42 EEC requirements and further amendments.
Yarns used to produce our socks are all certified by Oeko-Tex ensuring the highest quality and protection to the health of users as they are free from harmful substances.
Graduated compression was tested and approved in compliance with the British Standard (BS6612:1985).
What football players say about the inPocket Pro socks?

Dozens of inPocket Pro prototypes were developed and the production method was continuously re-thought until we finally achieved what we consider a perfect solution for footballers. Over a dozen of optimised versions were shipped for validation and affirming feedback was received from all players. At this point, we are ready for mass production.
Each member of our team is a specialist in his or her field: technology, engineering and IT
column3: and, design. Together, we unite different competencies and expertise to create a complete and strong team based on a stable and sustainable relationship so that we can work together successfully with passion and rationality.

column1: Our team is composed of highly trained and experienced members. We share common personal values: importance of teamwork, curiosity, rigour, loyalty, friendship, sharing of knowledge, reaching personal and common goals, and of course, a great sense of humour.

Besides this team, we have several backstage supporters working with us, who help us keep this dream afloat. Our manufacturing partners, professional and amateur football players, family members and friends are key in turning this idea into a real product.

INBICTUM was born from listening, reading and observing. Our concept consists in enhancing our commitment with customers by understanding their pain points and needs, finding the right technological solution, and developing the most innovative and powerful products that customers can wear.
We are a highly passionate team with deep experience across multiple fields, all motivated to create breakthroughs for the benefit of our planet and society. We are an experienced team with IT, R&
column2: D in electronics, software, biomechanics and sports, and design core competencies, and sound know-how in the textile and apparel sector, all united in doing our best to connect technology, functionality and performance to high-quality garments. Together we have all the ingredients to create innovative products you can wear, and take advantages of during your daily routine, work or leisure time activities.

column1: Our mission is to provide you clothes that can give you more than any other. Clothes can be more than just fashion and give you more than just protection from natural hazards.  Clothes can offer you so much more: multifunctional performance, extra comfort, communication, life support, monitorization, and many more.

The inPocket Pro socks are our first product being commercialized in the global market. Soon we will introduce to you many others that are already prototyped and we can’t wait to launch them here for you. This campaign is extremely important to us as it will allow us to take INBICTUM to the next level.  We need your support to bring this in demand product to the market and complete successfully our first milestone. Help us to take clothes to an extra level of comfort, functionality, usability, performance and sustainability!
Be sure to join our VIP list to lock in a discount of 50% on your inPocket Pro socks.

Don’t leave your friends behind and help us get the word out. We also promote upcoming products, special sales or complimentary gifts to our fans on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram from time to time so keep an eye out.

This is our first product launched on Indiegogo. We have read a lot and learnt with some experts how the best approach to be succeed in this campaign. We plan our logistics meticulously and know what we have to do to accomplish our goal.

However, we are aware that we might have to face new challenges as this is our first time. The main one might be related to the planned timeline of the delivery of rewards. Although we've already produced several prototypes together with our experienced manufacturer whose annual production exceeds millions of units, there can always be unforeseen challenges or circumstances that we cannot control and eventually can delay the production or delivery of your inPocket Pro socks.
If any issue comes up, of course, we will keep you in the loop every step of the way. We believe in communication and transparency!

¡Hola! Soy David García, piloto de trial en bici mexicano, llevo cerca de 13 años en este bello deporte, soy uno de los principales promotores en México y a lo largo de mi carrera he hecho un gran número de exhibiciones y competencias en todo México. Soy 4 veces campeón nacional y tengo un récord mundial en ascenso de escaleras, siendo yo, el único mexicano que ha competido fuera del país.

Este año he decidido llegar al siguiente nivel, voy a romper un récord mundial subiendo el mayor número de escaleras en bicicleta, ¿pero, por qué lo hago? Me gusta inspirar a otros, el trial es un gran deporte pero muy pocas personas saben acerca de este, al hacer esto me gustaría ver a más pilotos iniciarse y demostrar a las personas en general que sólo si tienes el coraje suficiente puedes lograr lo que sea que te propones, sin importar que sea, quiero inspirar a otros a que salgan de su zona de confort y hagan algo increíble.
La persona que me enseñó este deporte cambió mi vida, con el simple hecho de enseñarme un deporte, así que, si puedo inspirar aunque sea a una sola persona todo esto valdrá la pena.

¿Qué necesito y qué obtienes?
Este récord sería imposible sin todo el equipo de trabajo que está a mi lado así como el equipo que utilizo durante los entrenamientos.

En caso de no alcanzar la meta, todo los fondos serán usados para pagar equipo de entrenamiento y promoción del evento, después de todo, no puedo romper el récord sin el equipo adecuado y no podría inspirar a nadie si no logro transmitir el mensaje y la historia que hay detrás.
Las personas tienen un potencial enorme, pero en general existe un miedo que los limita a hacer cosas nuevas, incluso hay quienes no tienen idea de que hacer con sus vidas.
Tu contribución me va a ayudar a continuar con mi carrera deportiva y además ayudará a inspirar a otros a salir y hacer algo increíble.
Este es mi primer evento con tal magnitud, pero mi objetivo está en Dubai, ahí están los edificios más grandes del mundo.

Uno de los más grandes desafíos que enfrento es que aún siendo 4 veces campeón nacional tengo muy pocos patrocinadores, todos aportan lo que les es posible, pero aún así no es suficiente para explotar este evento al máximo. Ser un atleta patrocinado en México parece ser imposible, nadie cree en ti a menos que ya seas un atleta que está en la cima, aunque es un gran desafío también es una gran motivación, voy a demostrar que aun sin patrocinadores o gente que crea en ti, puedes lograr lo imposible.
El riesgo más grande en este récord es que la bicicleta falle durante el ascenso y que me haga caer, eso sería devastador.

Otro riesgo que enfrento día a día es que, debido al intenso entrenamiento: levantamientos olímpicos, correr, Crossfit y bicicleta puedo sufrir una lesión, lo que me haría cambiar la fecha del evento, pero puedes estar seguro de que ese récord lo voy a romper.
No todo es dinero, también puedes ayudar pasando la voz con tus conocidos y en tus redes sociales.

Summary

Hey there! I'm David García, a Mexican bike trials rider, I've been riding trials for about 13 years, I am one of the promoters of this sport in my country and I've been doing shows and competitions all over México. I am 4 times national champion, world record holder and the only rider who has competed outside the country.

Today I'm taking this to the next level, I'm going to establish a new world record by climbing steps by bike, but why am I doing this? Well.. I like to inspire people and bike trials is such a great sport but nobody knows about it, by doing this I'm expecting to see more and more riders and show people that only if you have enough courage and will they can achieve anything they want, I want to encourage others to push themselves.
The person who introduced me to the sport changed my life, so if I can do the same and inspire for at least one person it will all be worth it

column6: >What I need and what you get

column1: This record will be impossible without all the team that is working with me and the equipment I need for training sessions and the event.

In case the funds goal is not reached all the collected money is going to be used for training equipment and to promote the event after all I can't break the record without the right equipment nor will I be able to inspire others if I can't get the message to them of why and the history behind it.

In return you can get a personalized jersey of the event, the same one I'll be using! :)

The impact
People are awesome but they are afraid of doing new things or just don't know what to do with their lives, that's why I want to inspire people to go out and challenge themselves.
Your contribution is going to help me continue my career as an athlete but it will also help me to inspire others to do great things in life.
This is my first time doing this type of challenge but the ultimate goal is to climb a building in Dubai, that's where you can find the tallest buildings on earth.

Risks and challenges

The challenges I'm facing is that even though I'm 4 times national champion I only have a couple sponsors, which are good to start the project but not enough to expand the event to its fullest. Having a sponsorship as an athlete in México is pretty much impossible, no body believes in you unless you are already on the top, this is one of my greatest motivations I'm gonna prove that even without big sponsors you can do great things, money should never be an obstacle.
The biggest risks of this record is that the bike fails during the event making me fall, that will be just the end of it.

Another risk is due to all the hard training, cardio, weightlifting and bike riding I can get injured forcing me to change the date of the event, but be sure that I will set a new world record, there is no way I'm going to stop fighting for it.

Other ways to help

It's not all about money
column2: you can help me spread the word! That's a crucial part of this event.

Check out the upgraded version of Ingo, Ingo Glow at Indiegogo currently running campaign
column5: >Ingo : A moldable plastic in just using hot water.

column1: INGO Biodegradable Polymer with non-toxic coloring. A successful funded in Indiegogo.
With the generosity of our backers, this will mean we'll be able to produce faster and cheaper, keeping the price of our product low and improving delivery times.

Everything from replacing broken handles on work tools to fixing broken drawer handle and replacing a missing bottle cap, or even creating a portable holder on iPhones and Androids, INGO can be put to use in almost any situation— and the only limit is our own imagination!

Yet, despite the great usability, I'm well aware that some of our would-be backers out there might still not be entirely sure about what our product is and what it can do. For this reason I've decided to add a quick overview of INGO, just to briefly explain the properties and the almost limitless benefits this amazing product brings to the table. <div>

INGO is a handy, pocket-sized piece of moldable, non-toxic polymer that can be quickly heated and molded to practically any shape: INGO is strong enough to be used to fix and modify the world around you.
And it's so easy to use—just drop the card into a cup of boiling water (60 °C) for 3 minutes until it begins to soften. Then you can take it out of the cup and mold it into the shape of your choice.
In short, it’s reusable. Remember, it will be hot so don't burn your fingers!
INGO is available in 3 primary colors, (Red, Yellow, and Blue), as well as white and black in a box.
The best thing you can combine any of these colors to come up with new colors of your choosing. It have included a color combination chart in every box of Ingo.<div>

When they're hot, INGO will stick to other plastics to create a strong bond, making them ideal if you need to repair children's toys, tools or just about any other plastic product you would otherwise throw away.
Of course, we take great care to ensure our product is of extremely high-quality, which is why our products are made from a completely non-toxic, starch based bio-plastic.
We’re working very closely with the chemical company, molders and the colorant supplier to keep it that way. We've even made it our policy to reject styrene-packed universal pigments
column2: this makes the whole production process a bit messier for us, but better and a lot safer for the planet.

Ingo is a improve version of many morphing plastic brand outside. We being adding pigment to morphing plastic many year until one of our friend suggest to pre-added the color as the color pigment are very costly if they get it individually. So we come up with the 3 primary colors together with black and white mixing chart and Ingo chocolate bar design. This will ensure our user can create all the colors from just 1 Ingo box.
For example if you want a violet color, you just need to dip 2 pips of red and a pips of blue and mixed it. Our aims is to produce high quality and lowest price.
Resell Ingo in your local community. A discounted rate with profit margin more than 50%.
We appoint a limited number of distributor per country to cut down delivery time and shipping cost.  We will list all the distributor in the website soon. Contact us if you are interested.

I am very excited for this opportunity to reach out and give a hand up!  With the I Pour Life organization I will be be going to Ethiopia and providing some humanitarian efforts.  This includes setting up medical stations to provide medical assistance for communities, volunteering in hospitals, working in an orphanage, and getting to share my love of soccer by providing a soccer camp!

Your contributions are appreciated and valued!  Thank you so much for deciding to help us not give a hand out but a hand up!

column2: >     My name is maria Mills and I am an LPGA Class A teaching professional.  I have over 25 years of experience as a golf instructor and over 15 as a certified club fitter.  Up until last summer, I was employed by Dick's Sporting Goods as a golf shop manager/club fitter.  I was part of the 500 plus professionals and apprentices that lost their job without notice.  The store that I managed was a top 5 store out of 500 plus stores in custom fitting orders and golf equipment sales due to my expertise as a club fitter and also due to my reputation in Central PA as a great golf instructor.

column3: >     For the past 11 years, the golf academy has operated on a transient basis from several golf course/driving range facilities in the Harrisburg and Mechanicsburg, PA area.  It was a transient business because I was employed full time as a golf professional at a local Dick's Sporting Goods store.  In April 2015, I was given the opportunity to lease a building and open the golf academy in a more permanent location at a golf course/driving range in Mechanicsburg, PA.  Because this new opportunity came together very quickly, I did not have adequate time to fully secure the financial backing necessary to realize my full vision for the golf academy.  That vision includes physical upgrades to the driving range and miniature golf course, merchandise inventory for a golf shop (including equipment sales and repairs) and equipment for club fitting and indoor/off-season instruction and practice.  A priority for the Maria Mills Golf Academy is to develop both the facility and instructional programs in order to meet the needs of all populations, including but not limited to individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorders and military veterans with disabilities.  Ultimately, I also envision Maria Mills Golf Academy hosting a chapter of the First Tee Program and the LPGA-USGA Girls Golf Club.

column2: >     My secondary goal is to provide for my employees. As the business grows I would like to be able to pay them a living wage.  I want them to have the security of knowing that when the business succeeds- they will too.  I was with DSG for almost 10 years and was given absolutely no warning of losing my job.  We were told to come in for a conference call.  That was it.  I want my employees to know that I value them and what they bring to the business.  Its the way things should be.

Hello, my name is Jamie Thompson, and I'm a state-licensed massage therapist in Massachusetts (license number
column5: lb=MT"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"" title="""">MT-9356-MT). I graduated from Cortiva Institute - Boston in July 2009 after completing a twelve-month, 750-hour program leading to a diploma in professional massage therapy. While enrolled at Cortiva as a full-time student (attending classes three days per week), I also worked part-time (twenty hours per week) as the church administrator for First Church Somerville UCC (my ""day job,"" which I still have), continued to raise my twelve-year-old daughter, Sophia, as a single parent, and completed a two-year term on the ONEin3 Boston Mayor's Advisory Council, where I served as chairperson of the ""Young Families"" subcommittee.

column1: Now I'm the self-employed sole proprietor of Red Lotus Massage and Bodywork, a part-time massage therapy business which I founded this past fall in Boston's Brighton Center neighborhood. I'm also a professional member of the American Massage Therapy Association, and have earned over one hundred hours of continuing education from The Upledger Institute (CranioSacral Therapy I and II), Zero Balancing Health Association (Core Zero Balancing I and II and Northeast Conference and Review Day), and The Bodywork Education Project. I'm pursuing certification in both CranioSacral Therapy and Zero Balancing and am also studying for the national certification exam offered by the National Certification Board for Therapeutic Massage and Bodywork.

I first became interested in massage therapy - and complementary and integrative medicine in general - after suffering for years from chronic migraine and tension headaches. Massage therapy, combined with other holistic therapies such as acupuncture, yoga and qigong, and mindfulness-based stress reduction, helped alleviate my symptoms and decreased both the severity and frequency of my headaches. Based on my own experiences with massage, I decided to embark upon a new career as a massage therapist myself, to help others suffering from chronic stress and pain.

Massage therapy has worked for me, and I've seen it work for others, too. Caring, compassionate, nurturing touch has a profoundly calming and relaxing effect on a person, reducing stress and anxiety and increasing one's physical, mental, and spiritual health and wellbeing. In addition to being scientifically proven to help with physical ailments such as headaches, back pain, cancer, arthritis, etc., massage therapy is also beneficial to children and adults suffering from AD/HD, depression, trauma, and other mental, emotional, and psychospiritual conditions.

Sadly, however, many of the people who could benefit from massage therapy the most are those least able to afford it. As someone who comes from a working class background and is a low-income earner herself, I am highly sensitive to the economic realities of this industry. Red Lotus Massage and Bodywork is committed to making massage therapy affordable and accessible to all - regardless of socioeconomic status, sexual orientation, ethnicity, etc., as stated in the mission and vision statement - and to transforming the world through the healing power of touch, one person at a time.

While Red Lotus is not officially incorporated as a nonprofit, it has always operated as one. Motivated by values of lovingkindness and sustainability rather than greed and profits-over-people, Red Lotus seeks to bring massage therapy to underserved populations through volunteer work in the greater Boston community
column2: generous discounts to students, senior citizens, bodyworkers, and professional caregivers (teachers, ministers, nurses, social workers, and others)
column3: pro bono sessions to those experiencing extreme hardship
column4: and, in lieu of a traditional sliding fee scale, a special ""Good Karma"" pay-what-you-can rate to those earning at or below 175% of the federal poverty guidelines. This unwavering commitment to serving others and giving back to the community is what sets Red Lotus apart from other bodyworkers and small business owners out there.

column1: This is my first-ever campaign here on IndieGoGo, and I have set a goal of $500. The funds raised will be used to purchase an Oakworks Portal Pro massage chair, carrying case, and sternum pad, a package which currently retails for $514 ($489 for the chair and carrying case, plus $25 for the sternum pad). Although cheaper massage chairs do exist, based on reviews from other massage therapists, recommendations from Cortiva instructors and others in the field, and my own experiences with the Oakworks brand, the Portal Pro is an excellent investment because it is a high-quality, durable chair that should last for years and provide superior client comfort. Other professional massage chairs (such as the Earthlite Avila II) are within the same price range, so this goal is a reasonable one. If I am able to purchase the chair for less through another vendor, then any remaining funds would be used to buy face cradle covers, business cards, and other marketing materials and supplies.

Owning a portable massage chair will allow me to grow my small business and fulfill my mission of making massage affordable and accessible to all by offering seated massage at my Brighton office and volunteering at local nonprofit organizations and events. A massage chair is much easier to transport than a table (especially for someone like me who doesn't own a car and commutes via public transportation), and will allow me to offer massage in venues where it's simply not feasible to bring a regular massage table. Furthermore, new clients who may be initially apprehensive about receiving a full massage treatment (such as survivors of sexual abuse and domestic violence, who tend to have boundary issues regarding touch) may be more receptive to seated chair massage sessions, which are shorter in duration and performed with the client fully clothed.

Regardless of whether my goal is met or not, I will continue to do everything I can to make massage and bodywork accessible and affordable to all. But your donation - of any monetary amount, large or small - will help make this vision a reality today rather than tomorrow. Your generosity will go a long way towards helping my small business's outreach and philanthropic efforts succeed. Everyone, regardless of their income level or background, deserves access to healthcare services that lead to greater vitality and wellbeing in body, mind, and spirit. Everyone, not just those who are affluent, should have an opportunity to receive massage and bodywork services and experience their transformative and healing effects.

You can also help by spreading the word about the benefits of massage therapy, tellling others about Red Lotus Massage and Bodywork, and sending lots of positive thoughts and good vibes this way. Connect with Red Lotus on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Foursquare - buy a gift certificate for yourself or a loved one - spread the word about Red Lotus's mission and services, including discounts and ""Good Karma"" pay-what-you-can rate for low-income clients.

If you don't live in Boston, please find a massage therapist in your area and support her or him by receiving regular bodywork in your hometown. Donate to organizations such as the Massage Therapy Foundation. Learn more about mindfulness-based stress reduction, acupuncture, yoga, qigong, Reiki, and other mind/body therapies and practices. Browse the rest of the IndieGoGo website (or similar sites such as Kiva and Kickstarter) and find other worthy causes to donate your time and resources to.

Hello everyone, as some of you may already have heard, Trina is seriously ill. She has been in intensive care for over ten days now after emergency bowel surgery and it seems she faces a long recovery stay in hospital and will need to spend more time in recovery at home.
The emergency arose because Trina lives with celiac disease,
column2: >a condition that damages the lining of the small intestine preventing the body from absorbing certain kinds of food, including gluten. Unknowingly, Trina was consuming small amounts of gluten over time until the build up led to sudden and severe perforations of her bowel.

column1: We all know Trina as a completely fabulous and highly committed woman – if you’re a friend or family member, you know she has always been a person you can count on to come through for you. As an activist, Trina has given so much coming up with one brilliant idea after another to knit together, support and celebrate our community. She puts out the best of herself when she’s working on a project and she pulls out the best from those who are working with her. And, of course, all of this, when she’s a wonderful mother to three kids and works near to full time.

This health emergency will hugely affect Trina and her family, both emotionally and financially - particularly as we come to the Christmas season.   A simple and concrete way we can all help Trina get through this is to help out financially by sending her a donation, ANY amount will be deeply appreciated (ANY AMOUNT AT ALL).
Please help us get the word out and make some noise about Trina's need by sharing this with others.
If we all give a few dollars we can help Trina pay the rent, buy food and give her babies a modest Christmas.
This campaign ends soon so please don't delay! Their financial need is immediate.

Thank you for caring and for showing that as a group we have the power to fix this!
","Trina Needs Help!

Hello everyone, as some of you may already have heard, Trina is seriously ill. She has been in intensive care for over ten days now after emergency bowel surgery and it seems she faces a long recovery stay in hospital and will need to spend more time in recovery at home.

The emergency arose because Trina lives with celiac disease, a condition that damages the lining of the small intestine preventing the body from absorbing certain kinds of food, including gluten. Unknowingly, Trina was consuming small amounts of gluten over time until the build up led to sudden and severe perforations of her bowel.

We all know Trina as a completely fabulous and highly committed woman – if you’re a friend or family member, you know she has always been a person you can count on to come through for you. As an activist, Trina has given so much coming up with one brilliant idea after another to knit together, support and celebrate our community. She puts out the best of herself when she’s working on a project and she pulls out the best from those who are working with her. And, of course, all of this, when she’s a wonderful mother to three kids and works near to full time.

This health emergency will hugely affect Trina and her family, both emotionally and financially - particularly as we come to the Christmas season.   A simple and concrete way we can all help Trina get through this is to help out financially by sending her a donation, ANY amount will be deeply appreciated (ANY AMOUNT AT ALL).
Please help us get the word out and make some noise about Trina's need by sharing this with others.
If we all give a few dollars we can help Trina pay the rent, buy food and give her babies a modest Christmas.
This campaign ends soon so please don't delay! Their financial need is immediate.
Thank you for caring and for showing that as a group we have the power to fix this!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hello, my name is Rob Santos and I currently work in the health field.  In my area of concentration, I often come accross people in their homes who live in conditions which only worsen their medical problems.  This campaign aims at helping an elderly woman who a friend of mine is treating.  This woman is currently battling cancer and is undergoing radiation therapy.  As a complication of her treatment, she is suffering from a large wound which is requiring extra measures to address.  If her luck wasn't bad enough, both of her air conditioning units broke within a week of each other - due in no small part to the high heat we have here in Texas.  If we could raise enough money to replace at least on of the units with a more efficient and reliable one then she would at least be safe from the harsh conditions she is curently having to deal with.  As far as environments and wounds go, a wound does not do well at all in a hot and humid environment - She needs this to achieve the best possible outcome with treatment.  If we are successful, please know that you have truly been an important part of this person's healing process.  Thank you for your contributions!

If you are interested in seeing when this person receives her A/C unit please provide me an e-mail where I can send you a picture of the recipt, A/C unit and the patient (if she allows picture taking).
Thanks in advance for anything you can do to help her out!

Hi, my name is Sonny, I'm currently serving as a Marine Officer on Camp Pendleton, California. A few years ago, I came across a book called: ""It Happened On The Way To War - A Marine's Path To Peace"" that profoundly impacted my life. It was a story of a fellow Marine Officer - Rye Barcott, who launched a non-profit initiative to prevent violence by organizing an inter-ethnic sports programs in Kibera, Africa's largest slum of almost a million inhabitants where the average person subsists on merely $1 per day.

Rye developed lifelong relationships with some of the Kenyans that he met there, and partnering with local Kiberans and focused on empowering local leaders to make decisions to improve their community instead of guiding it with a ""Western hand"". Over the years, Rye's modest initiative has now blossomed into a fully fledged non-profit that operates a clinic that is partnered with the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and serves over 41,000 patients annually.

Rye's story had a profound impact on my life because it compelled me to take action. Having lived in South Africa for six years, I've witnessed the heartbreaking effects of abject destitution as a child, and always vowed that I would do something about it. Now is the time to take the first steps!

This May, I will be traveling to Kibera to volunteer at the Tabitha Clinic. It will be an opportunity for me to live amongst the people, and have a small taste of the extreme deprivation that Kiberans suffer through every day. However, the last thing they need is another rich American ""humanitarian tourist"" who is going to come in, journal about the conditions, take photos with children, and go about his life.

No! This is an opportunity to make a lasting impact! While I was in Afghanistan, I corresponded briefly by email with Rye and members of his organization - Carolina for Kibera (named after Rye's alma mater, UNC-Chapel Hill). Recently, I asked CFK if there was anything I could do, anything that I could bring from the United States that would be of use to them. They provided me with the Tabitha Clinic's Wish List. I promised them that somehow, someway, I'm going to make this happen to the utmost of my abilities, but I'm going to need your help!
General and Emergency care equipment (order of priority):
http://helid.digicollection.org/en/d/Jwho28e/12.html#Jwho28e.12 (link to a table of gear needed for the kits)

• Make a financial contribution. 100% of the proceeds from this fundraising campaign will go towards purchasing equipment needed by the Tabitha Clinic. Any unspent remnant will be donated to Carolina For Kibera, a 501(c) non-profit organization that has received a maximum of 4 out of 4 stars from Charity Navigator.

• Make a material contribution. All the equipment needed is listed above. Please coordinate with me by email at stai0331@gmail.com or Suzanne Thomson of Carolina for Kibera at suzanne@carolinaforkibera.org
• Tell people about this campaign! The more people we get on the bandwagon, the greater impact we'll be able to make!

I can promise you 100% transparency. Your contributions will ONLY fund purchases for the equipment listed above, and the remainder will be donated directly to Carolina for Kibera. Your contribution will NOT fund my airfare, expenses, meals, taxi fare, or any personal expense related to this trip. All  such expenses will be funded from my personal savings.

I can promise that I WILL maintain meticulous records of every transaction on an Excel Spreadsheet. I WILL keep copies of every single receipt from every single purchase I make with campaign funds. All of these records and documentations WILL be available upon request!

I can promise that your contribution WILL make an impact and change lives. The Tabitha Clinic provides free healthcare to over 41,000 Kenyans living in a community where the average wage is only a dollar a day, but the clinic doesn't have everything it needs. This equipment will enable the poorest people in the world to come closer to receiving the level of care that they deserve.

Hi, my name is Sonny, I'm currently serving as a Marine Officer on Camp Pendleton, California. A few years ago, I came across a book called: ""It Happened On The Way To War - A Marine's Path To Peace"" that profoundly impacted my life. It was a story of a fellow Marine Officer - Rye Barcott, who launched a non-profit initiative to prevent violence by organizing an inter-ethnic sports programs in Kibera, Africa's largest slum of almost a million inhabitants where the average person subsists on merely $1 per day.

Rye developed lifelong relationships with some of the Kenyans that he met there, and partnering with local Kiberans and focused on empowering local leaders to make decisions to improve their community instead of guiding it with a ""Western hand"". Over the years, Rye's modest initiative has now blossomed into a fully fledged non-profit that operates a clinic that is partnered with the US Center for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), and serves over 41,000 patients annually.

Rye's story had a profound impact on my life because it compelled me to take action. Having lived in South Africa for six years, I've witnessed the heartbreaking effects of abject destitution as a child, and always vowed that I would do something about it. Now is the time to take the first steps!

This May, I will be traveling to Kibera to volunteer at the Tabitha Clinic. It will be an opportunity for me to live amongst the people, and have a small taste of the extreme deprivation that Kiberans suffer through every day. However, the last thing they need is another rich American ""humanitarian tourist"" who is going to come in, journal about the conditions, take photos with children, and go about his life.

No! This is an opportunity to make a lasting impact! While I was in Afghanistan, I corresponded briefly by email with Rye and members of his organization - Carolina for Kibera (named after Rye's alma mater, UNC-Chapel Hill). Recently, I asked CFK if there was anything I could do, anything that I could bring from the United States that would be of use to them. They provided me with the Tabitha Clinic's Wish List. I promised them that somehow, someway, I'm going to make this happen to the utmost of my abilities, but I'm going to need your help!

http://helid.digicollection.org/en/d/Jwho28e/12.html#Jwho28e.12 (link to a table of gear needed for the kits)

Hi, my name is Maria Musarella. I was an ocullar geneticist who researched cures for children's eye diseases. You can google me to see all the research I have done to help children with eye diseases causing them to go blind. In 2002, I had to retire because of Stage 3 Thyroid cancer. Radiation caused my teeth to fall out and dental repair is expensive.  I also have Multiple system atrophy, a rare degenerative brain disease, which has left me in a wheelchair and bedridden most of the time, but my upper body strength is normal, allowing me to hit golf balls. Golf is my greatest pleasure in life but I'm not allowed to go on the golf course with the wheelchair.  The paramobile would allow me to go on the course and play in a standing position. I also suffer from diabetes and bipolar disease. I'm on 16 medications. The funds  would help with dental repair, medications and the paramobile which would allow me to play golf.  I need about $40,000 for my dental work and to buy a paramobile.  Thank you for your help!

I am a mother of 1 and about to be a grandmother of 2. For the last 25 years I have been an visual artist.
Quite recently, in fact on April 27 2012, I had received confirmation from my neuro surgeon, that I had a tumor behind my left eye.
This tumor is is encroaching on my optic nerve and there is a high possibilty that I will lose the use of that eye. That's the bad news....the good news is that he can remove it, saving my sight.
I am unable to get insurance to take care of this as, I have an pre-existing condition. 7 years ago I survived breast cancer. For me to get new insurance, I would be on 1 year waiting period....
I can't afford to wait, I need to take care of this right away.
What I am asking for is the deposit I require to make this happen. The total bill for the hospital, doctor, labs, assistants, and the whole works is $58,000.
I require $27,000 to complete the operation and the hospital stay. Once I have recovered from this, I will go back to work....and continue to create to pay off the balance.
I know that I am asking SO MUCH.....but I want to see my grandchildren and I want to continue to create. I am 52 and don't believe I am ready for the darken room.
If you can't donate, please spread the word......

My brother has been struggling with diabetes all his life.

Like many Americans he has worked for several companies doing the best job he can at everything he does.  Unfortunately his diabetes limits his performance some in his case.  He recently last week fell very ill and went to urgent care.  The rushed him to the hospital and put him on an insulin drip to get his sugar levels normal and then tried to find out what was wrong with him.  After several blood tranfusions and a myriad of medical procedures including slicing open his leg to let the infection drain they discovered that he has the infamous flesh eating bacteria attacking his leg.
The doctors are not optimistic about saving his leg and are worried about saving him!

I work for the US Army Corps of Engineers and am deployed to Afghanistan.  My mother, Father and Sister are with him in Buffalo, NY.  The most I can do right now is send money to help cover his medical bills and household expenses.  I don't know how much this will all cost but and asking for $100K in donations to get started.
Of course food and anything you can provide for recovery can and will be accepted by my Mother, Father or sister, to help Carl recover WHEN he comes home!
Just label the stuff:  For Carl and leave it at the house.

201 Euclid Ave                                              8968 East Eden Road
Hamburg, NY 14075                                      Eden, NY 14057

 Think of the waffles as THIRSTY POCKETS. They soak up MORE water and FASTER. 

The open weaves maximize surface exposure for airflow. BREATHABILITY guaranteed.

 

 

 

A dry towel is a clean towel. The airy waffles effectively prevent the multiplication of odor caused by bacteria and fungus. You will never reach out to a wet, musty towel after a shower anymore. 

 

 

 

 

While the waffle structure intrinsically maximizes surface exposure for airflow for guaranteed breathability, allowing the towel to dry itself out quickly, we have fundamentally improved the performance of Kosmu Towel with advanced science and technology.

Kosmu Towel employs an advanced spinning technology that can store air across the cotton threads. Dissolving the pre-woven hydrosoluble fibers enveloped by cotton, Aerocore Technology® helps create tubular cotton fibers, making for 160% higher water absorbency, 2X speed to dry, 70% Less shedding rate than the industry standard.

 

 

 

 

Kosmu towel is crafted of the actual world’s most optimized innovation of towel fabrics, a combination of 70% of extra fine cotton (with an extremely long fiber length of 37mm and a world-best 48.3 g/.tex fibers strength) and 30% premium natural silk ( 25 MM and 3.5CN/d).

 

 

 

We partnered with the affiliated manufacturer of Japan’s largest towel manufacturing and distribution group –Towel Museum (タオル美術館グループ), which has built long-term partnerships with leading global brands such as JILL STUART, ROYAL COPENHAGEN, MINTON, OROBIANCO, Adidas, Disney, etc. Most of our manufacturer’s portfolio sells through high-end Japanese marketplace: 90% of its product mix is sold to premium department stores in Japan through local sales agents, e.g.Takashimaya, Isetan, Mitsukoshi, Hankyu, Daimaru
column2: and the rest of its businesses include sales in overseas business. It provides both assurance and quality in all its products at prices that meet customer needs by full management of product quality in all states of the manufacturing process.

Over a year ago we began an ambitious journey to transform the way we refresh ourselves in our bathroom. When we take it for granted that it is the bath itself that recharges us, we find out that the daily ritual after your bath actually plays a much more significant role. In this ritual, you are with your bath towel, as always.

 

However, the towel industry has not really changed across the past century. We are still in the restless journey of searching for the right bath towel, facing an ocean of towels with unequal and hard-to-expect qualities.

 

Kosmu is changing the picture by tackling the “Towel Dilemma” with science. Voluminousness and quick-dry are not necessarily contradictory. After many studies, design iterations, and prototypes, we finally create the waffle-shaped cotton-silk towel which solves the “Towel Dilemma” with design, technology, and material innovation.

 

We are now in the final stage of development. Together, we can improve how people recharge themselves with the daily bath ritual. With your support, we will be able to kick off production.

Created with diatomaceous earth, Kosmu Earth Mat dries instantly under your feet, keeping your bathroom clean and odor-free with thoughtful design.

 

Diatomaceous earth, or grass of the sea, is a natural mineral that occurred from the fossilized remains of aquatic organisms. Its pore structure makes the moisture evaporate immediately, leaving no chance for germs and mold to grow.

 

Say hello to Kippo as well. We are pretty sure that our cuddle boy will bring some warmth to your bathroom.

column1: Say Hello to the World’s Simplest Smart Blinds
The Sunsa Wand is the easiest and most affordable way to automate and turn your blinds smart in under 2 minutes. Save time, energy, and money by automating your blinds.

✅ Automate, motorize and make any blinds smart
✅ Installs in under 2 minutes
✅ Keep your current blinds
✅ Control your blinds from anywhere with your phone
✅ Works with Amazon Alexa &
column2:
Google Assistant for voice control
✅ Create Schedules to automatically open and close your blinds
✅ Multiple power options, AA Batteries, solar &
column3:
wall plug
✅ Connects directly to Wifi, no additional hubs to buy
✅ Great for hard to reach blinds and help with accessibility

column1: The Sunsa Wand upgrades your current blinds to smart blinds in under 2 minutes
Simply replace your current blind’s wand with the Sunsa Wand and you have automated, motorized smart blinds that can tilt your blinds open and close.
Control your blinds anywhere, anytime right from your phone with the Sunsa App for IOS and Android. Open and close your blinds to shut out the glare or open them up to enjoy the view.
The Sunsa App for IOS and Android makes it easy to fully open your blinds, close them or anything in between to get it exactly right.

Create schedules that automatically tilt your blinds open and close. Wake up to natural light in the morning and close at night for privacy.  You can even make it look like someone is home when you are away for vacation or business.
Wake up naturally to sunlight with schedules.

Create groups that let you control as many blinds as you want at the same time.  Want to close all the blinds in your house?  No problem.   There is no limit to the number of groups you can have and blinds can be in multiple groups.
The Sunsa Wand replaces your current blind’s wand, so any blind that has a wand and tilts will work, which includes horizontal, vertical and mini blinds.
Over 2 years of research and development and hundreds of blinds later…
We created the Sunsa Wand, the perfect solution that is elegant, simple to use, and packs a ton of tech.

Although there is a lot of awesome tech packed into the Sunsa Wand, so you never have to worry about your blinds again. You can still use the wand by hand if you ever wanted to manually open or close your blinds.
Included in the box are adapters and tips that will make sure the Sunsa Wand works with your blinds.  No matter if you have horizontal blinds, vertical blinds or mini blinds, we got you covered.
Since firmware on the Sunsa Wand can be updated over-the-air  (OTA) and our cloud-based infrastructure, we are always working on creating the integrations that matter to you.
